loans.name: Mun's Group

texts.en:
Mun is 47 years old, married with five children, and resides in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. 

She and her husband have grown rice for ten years. Their business earns about 30,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Mun has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles  and  used the previous loan to provide sufficient food for her family. 

She leads her group and will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan remembers being depressed due to the hardship he faced during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Jonathan, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Jonathan, is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 per hectare this season.  Jonathan expressed that beyond this season, he hopes to use his increased earning to increase the size of his farmland. With this loan, Jonathan is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Soert is a 56-year-old married mother of four children. 

Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 11 years.  Her husband raises cows to support the family and earn additional income. They earn about 48,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Soert has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She leads her group to seek a loan and will use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pay  labor costs. She hopes to produce a good crop,  improve her income and standard of living, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province, Sophy is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. 

She needs to support  three children who attend school. Rice farming and chicken raising are the main sources of income. 

Sophy previously borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has completely repaid her loan. She leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pay the plowing fee, and labor costs. 

She hopes to produce a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay the plowing fee, and labor costs.

loans.name: Sabitri Shg Group

texts.en:
Sabitri Self Help Group is composed of nine women from a small village in the Cuttack district of Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in activities such as vegetable cultivation, milk selling, paddy and maize cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women with a willingness to learn new business trends. They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses. 

One of the group members, Bilasini, is the president of this group. The lady standing with her hand raised is Bilasini. Bilasini is 31 years old and lives with her husband and one child, who is 10 years old. She does vegetable cultivation. She produces vegetables, such as tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflowers, brinjals, lady fingers, onions, etc., and sells them at the market. Her husband is a farmer. He helps Bilasini sell vegetables at the market.

Bilasini is planning to buy standard-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so she can produce more vegetables and increase her income. Bilasini along with her group members is asking for a loan to invest in her business activities. Bilasini will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation. She wants to give a better education to her children. She says on behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: To purchase standard-quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a 30-year-old farmer from Gidan Jaki.  As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ayuba can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Ayuba is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Ayuba is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Jummai,and  Banis. Ayuba’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Mika

texts.en: Mika remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Mika, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Mika is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, expressed Mika. With this loan, Mika is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Ibrahim, Aisha, and  Dinatu.. Musa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Musa will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Musa can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Musa is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Daniel, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Daniel  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Daniel. With this loan, Daniel is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a Babban Gona farmer from Gidan Jaki. Emmanuel expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Emmanuel to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Emmanuel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Emmanuel is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Emmanuel will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Emmanuel will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Teresa está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, trabajando y luchando por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Salvadora, ella es la presidenta del grupo, una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para hacer comidas, ya que ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas variadas.
Quiere comprar verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo, jamón, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Santa Teresa Group is in its first loan cycle with the women's bank program, in which they all committed to working and helping each other get ahead.  They're doing the poverty elimination survey, working and striving to improve.

Salvadora, one of the members, is the president of the group.  She's a very persevering and self-sacrificing woman who's making an effort to get ahead and improve her living conditions and her family's.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of ingredients to make meals, because she earns a living making and selling various dishes.  She wants to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, ham, and other ingredients to keep on making her sales and striving to improve.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, ham, and other ingredients

loans.name: Sree Raghunath Shg Group

texts.en:
Kuni is a 42-year-old lady, who lives with her husband and two children, ages 15 and 10 years old, in a small village in the Cuttack district, Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Kuni. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. Some years ago, Kuni formed a group with seven other women from her village and named the group Sree Raghunath Self-Help Group (SHG). The group members are engaged in different business activities, such as selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc., to alleviate their poverty. 

Kuni is the president of this group. She motivated all the group members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives. Kuni along with her group requested a loan. She will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family, and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy (rice) cultivation.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret is a 43-year-old widow with four children; one attends school. Saret grows rice and resides in Battambang province.  She has been in business for several years and earns about 36,600 KHR per day. 

She has successfully repaid  her previous loan. She joined a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. 

She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
A local resident from Battambang province, Sokun is a 41-year-old married woman with 9 children. She meets her daily cost of living by growing rice.

Sokun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for seven cycles.  She has a successful repayment history. She joins a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop. 

She believes that she can increase the yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Dy is a farmer from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She earns an income growing rice. 

She earns approximately 41,000 KHR per day. This is the fourth loan for Dy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her previous loan. Her living conditions are  better than before. 

She leads a group of 3. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. 

She hopes to improve her yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

When asked, Indo said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Barnabas, Habila,  and  Yusuf, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро молодая экономически активная жительница города Душанбе. Ей 23 года. Она живет с родителями. Зухро 5 лет назад после окончания школы начала свою швейную деятельность. Она берет заказы на пошив женских платьев национального покроя. Зухро шьет профессионально и поэтому клиенты всегда остаются довольными ее работой. 
Сейчас в семье Зухро случилась беда. Ее отец очень сильно болен и на его лечение требуются большие деньги. К сожалению сбережения семьи не хватает на лечение и Зухро единственный выход из трудного положения видит в получении кредита. Она очень хочет, чтобы ее отец выздоровел и с надеждой просит Вас о помощи. Поддержите Зухро.
texts.en:
Zuhro is a young, frugal and active resident of Dushanbe.  She is 23 years old and she lives with her parents.  Five years ago, after Zuhro finished school, she started her own sewing business.  She takes orders to sew women's national costumes.  Zuhro sews at a professional level, which is why her clients are always satisfied with her work.

Now Zuhro's family is in trouble; her father is seriously ill and he needs money for his treatment.  Unfortunately, the family's savings is not sufficient to pay for the treatment and Zuhro's only way out of this difficult situation is to take out a loan.  She sincerely hopes that her father will return to health and with this hope, she asks you for your help.  Please support Zuhro.

loans.use: to pay for her father's medical treatment

loans.name: Rhoda Habila

texts.en: Rhoda Habila is a hardworking farmer.  As a Babban Gona member, Rhoda Habila, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with four children, two of whom go to school.  She has no additional family members.  She sells used clothes, and has been in this business for five years.  

Mary has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She generates additional income from selling stationery.  She works from home, and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include defaulting and transportation of bales of used clothes to her home. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler, and also to start importing used clothes. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because it was giving loans to the bottom poor. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and also feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is married and has three children, all attend school.  She also cares for additional family members. 

She has operated a retail food stall at the market for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX form MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, and onions.  She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include season changes and transportation.  

She wants to become a wholesaler and buy a plot of land . She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and  running water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassva, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married and has six children; all of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She operates a beauty salon, and has been in this business for 11 years. She works in a shop, and works on all types of hair but on retail basis for seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include on-and-off electricity, seasonality, and thieves.

Milly has applied for a loan of 2,300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cream relaxers, weaves, braids and a hand dryer.  

She aspires to buy a generator to be used when the power is off, and also to own a bridal salon.  Milly decided to join MCDT SACCO because of the good customer care. 

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy cream relaxers, weaves, braids, and shampoo

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is married with three children; all attend school. She also cares for a younger sister. 

She has had a food stall business for 5 years. She has applied for  200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy  cassava, bananas, tomatoes, onions and cabbage.  She sells on a retail basis and works from home seven days a week.  Safina generates additional income washing clothes. Her major business challenges include changing seasons and theft. 

She is wants to become a wholesaler and growing vegetables.  Safina resides in the family's house and has access to electricity but no running water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cassava, green bananas, tomatoes, and cabbage.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school. She has no additional family members. She sells used shoes and has been in this business for six years. 

Justine has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of shoes.  

She works at the market seven days a week and sells on retail basis.  Justine's major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become an importer of used shoes, and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Muhayokhon

texts.ru: Мухаёхон родом из города Исфара. Она 45-летняя замужняя женщина, воспитывающая двоих сыновей и дочь. Ее муж работает вдали от семьи. Мухаёхон сама раньше занималась торговлей сухофруктами, а сейчас она безработная. Поэтому она решила открыть новый бизнес. Мухаёхон хочет заниматься продажей детских сумок и учебных принадлежностей, так как скоро начнется новый учебный год. Мухаёхон планирует привозить товар с оптовых рынков города Душанбе и Худжанда, а затем продавать на рынках и селах своего города Исфара. Для начала бизнеса у нее есть сбережение в размере около 900 долларов США. Однако этой суммы недостаточно. В связи с этим Мухаёхон обратилась за кредитом. Она с надеждой ждет поддержки. Благодаря кредиту у нее снова будет источник дохода.
texts.en: Muhayokhon was born in the city of Isfara.  She is a 45-year-old married woman who has two sons and one daughter, and her husband works away from the family.  Muhayokhon used to sell dried fruits, but now she is unemployed.  For this reason, she has decided to start a new business.  Muhayokhon wants to sell children's bags and school supplies, as the new school year is starting soon.  She plans to purchase these goods at wholesale markets in Dushanbe and Khujand and then sell them at the markets and villages of her city of Isfara.  To start this business, she has saved up about 900 US dollars, but this is not enough.  Because of this, Muhayokhon has asked for a loan.  She is awaiting your support with hope.  This loan will allow her to have a new source of income.

loans.use: to buy children's bags and school supplies to start her new business

loans.name: Noeline

texts.en:
Noeline lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business selling plastic jerrycans, and has been in this business for five years.  

Noeline has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more plastic jerrycans. She generates additional income from selling sisal sacks/bags. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

She aspires to become a wholesaler, and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more old jerrycans

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children. All of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a family house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees. 

Charity operates a restaurant and has been in this business for one year. She sells on a retail basis, seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to start practicing outside catering. 

Charity has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT-SACCO) to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, Irish potatoes and fish. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of their good customer care.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, fish, Irish potatoes and flour for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a Babban Gona farmer from Jalawa. Nuhu expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Nuhu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Nuhu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Nuhu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Nuhu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Nuhu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Emmanuel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Sadiq, Bilya, and Isiya. Emmanuel is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Emmanuel will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Emmanuel can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Emmanuel said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland.” Emmanuel is not thinking about just this year.  In 5 years, he wants to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a drug shop and has been in this business for 4 months. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of tablets and syrups. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked drug shop and to educate her children to university. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy syrup and boxes of tablets

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children; two children go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Aisha sells charcoal from home on a retail basis and has been in this business for two years. She makes additional income from poultry farming. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to build more rooms for poultry farming.

Aisha has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT-SACCO) to buy bags of charcoal and poultry vaccines.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and poultry  vaccines.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johana  de 32 años de edad habita en el municipio de soledad  y se dedica a la venta de artículos mediante guidas especializadas de productos, que le ha suministrado una empresa a la cual está afiliada. Desde hace 3 años Johana inició su negocio,  cuando se dio cuenta que vender productos de calidad mediante este sistema resaltaba efectivo; fue así como decidió desarrollar la actividad comercial para generar ingresos y realizó sus primeros pedidos, con los cuales le fue muy bien. En su oferta sus clientes encuentran artículos para el hogar, perfumería, bisutería entre otros, trabajando en un horario que va desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y desde los lunes hasta los viernes. Sus compras las realiza a crédito y vende a principalmente a sus vecinos en el barrio donde habita. Su meta mas adelante es dar apertura a un almacén y diversificar la oferta de productos, para generar mas ingresos que permitan brindarle una mayor calidad educativa a sus hijos, En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos como  perfumería y detalles para el hogar, actuando sobre los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes. Con esta inversión tendrá un mas amplio surtido que el actual y podrá atender la demanda de su clientela, lo cual resultaría muy exitosa.
texts.en: Johana, 32 years old, lives in the Municipality of Soledad. She works selling items through specialized catalogs she gets from the company she works for. Johana started her business 3 years ago when she realized that selling quality products through this system was effective. This is how she decided to develop this business in order to generate income, and she had her first orders which went very well. In her offers her customers find home items, perfume items, custom jewelry, among others. Sh works from 9 in the morning to 7 at night, from Mondays to Fridays. She buys on credit and sells mainly to her neighbors in the neighborhood where she lives. Her goal in the future is to open a store and diversify the product offer in order to generate more income that will allow her children a better educational quality. Currently she is applying to a credikiva, her first loan from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy items such as perfume items and home accessories, based on her customers' orders. With this investment she will have a broader assortment than the current one, and she will be able to satisfy her customers' demands and possibly be very successful.

loans.use: to buy perfume related items and home accessories.

loans.name: Pedro Salvador

texts.es:
Pedro, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 7 y un año de edad, no tiene familiares en el extranjero; desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender variedad de bebidas tales como: agua de coco, refrescos naturales, gaseosas entre otros, trabaja de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., aprendió a realizar este negocio dentro de su familia, por el momento no representa dificultades en desarrollar esta actividad.
Invertirá en la compra de  gaseosas, azúcar, cocos, jugos, hielo, agua y bolsas, espera que su negocio se mantenga funcionando y generando ingresos importantes para subsistir junto con su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son dar a su familia todo lo necesario para tener una vida más digna y ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with his wife and with his two children, who are 7 and 1 years old. He does not have relatives abroad. For 5 years, he has sold various drinks, like coconut water, natural sodas, soda pops, and others. He works from 7:00 a. m. to 4:00 p. m. He learnt this trade from his family, and at the moment he does not encounter difficulties with his business.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of sodas, sugar, coconuts, juices, ice, water, and bags. He hopes that his business will continue to go well so that he has the income which is important for him and his family to survive. 

It is his wish to give his family all they need for a more dignified life, and to save enough money to buy his own house.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar, coconuts, juices, ice, water, and bags.

loans.name: Griselda Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Griselda, es una microempresaria exitosa de 28 años de edad, soltera, quien se dedica a hacer serigrafías en camisetas y mantas en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace tres años, gracias a la ayuda financiera de su papá y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pinturas, camisetas y telas.
texts.en: Griselda is a successful small business owner. She is 28 years old, single and her business is screen-printing shirts and blankets in her home. She started this business three years ago, thanks to the financial help of her father, and with the loan she wants to buy colors, shirts, and fabric.

loans.use: to buy colors, shirts, and fabric.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en: Magaji is a maize farmer from Baguiwa.  As a Babban Gona member, Magaji is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Magaji can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Magaji is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Magaji is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children: Hauwa,Zainab, and Yahaya. Magaji’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Ibrashima

texts.en: Ibrashima is a Babban Gona farmer from Baguiwa. Ibrashima expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Ibrashima to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ibrashima can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ibrashima is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Ibrashima will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Ibrashima will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Simon

Now,  Simon, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Simon  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Simon   With this loan, Simon is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

Saratu is hopeful about what the future holds.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa es una microempresaria exitosa de 51 años de edad y acompañada, su negocio es la venta de comida en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace doce anos y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, aceite, carne de res, pollo, carne de cerdo, ayote, zanahoria, salsa de tomate, vinagre, queso, repollo, lechuga, gaseosas, jugos, etc., con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado mejorar su negocio y aumentar la clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa is a successful small business owner. She is 51 years old and has a common law partner. He business is the sale of food in her home. She started this business 5 years ago and with the loan she wants to buy rice, oil, beef, chicken, pork, squash, carrots, tomato salsa, vinegar, cheese, cabbage, salad, sodas, juices, etc.

With her earlier loans, the member could improve her business and increase her client base.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat, chicken, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Juan de 45 años de edad es propietario de una tienda en su barrio, donde vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos, bebidas, lácteos etc. Su principal clientela son las mujeres amas de casa, que dia a dia preparan las comidas para su familia y compran al detalle, de acuerdo al ingreso diario de su esposo y aun de ellas mismas. Desde hace 14 años inició su actividad comercial , atendiendo a que desde muy niño adquirió la experiencia trabajando como empleado en algunas tiendas, hasta que finalmente en este mismo medio le ofrecieron la oportunidad de comprar una tienda y así lo hizo y desde entonces no se detiene. El posee un local comercial donde vende diariamente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche durante todos los dias de la semas. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su local y remodelar su vivienda donde habita con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad. Su mayor desafo es fidelizar su clientela con precios competitivos y un buen servicio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domino, mediante el cual comprará bebidas, láteos, cárnicos, verduras y frutas, con el fin de aumentar las ventas y sus utilidades, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Juan is 45 years old. He is the owner of a neighborhood store where he sells lunches, groceries, beverages, juices, dairy products, etc. His main customers are the women who are housewives who make meals every day for their families and who buy a little at a time according to their husbands' or even their own daily income. He started his commercial activity 14 years ago. He acquired experience since the time he was very young working as an employee in some stores, until finally he was offered a chance to buy a store and that's what he did and since then he hasn't stopped. He has a commercial locale where he sells every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night every day of the week. His goal for the future is to expand his locale and remodel the house where he lives with his spouse and his 8 year old son. His biggest challenge is to gain his customers' loyalty with competitive prices and good service. Right now, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan he is taking out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domino. With it he will buy beverages, dairy products, meats, vegetables and fruits in order to increase his sales and his profits, making his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, meats, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 22-year-old farmer from Ang/Lado.  As a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Emmanuel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Emmanuel is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  50 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Emmanuel is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Naomi,  and  Alheri,. Emmanuel’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Narkul

texts.ru: Наркул 53 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Наркул среднее образование, на протяжении 35 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных покупателей молока, на сегодняшний день, благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности в хозяйстве Наркул имеется: 1 корова с теленком и 1 лошадь, дополнительно занимается полеводством. Наркул хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота, так как экологически чистое молоко пользуется большим спросом среди местных жителей, в связи с этим она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы с теленком. На доходы от кредита Наркул хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем сделать капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en: Narkul is 53 years old, married and is a mother to two children. Narkul has a secondary education. For the past 35 years, she has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. She has been able to develop her business and attract loyal customers to buy her milk. Thanks to her hard work and tenacity, Narkul currently has 1 cow with a calf and 1 horse on her farm. She also has land for crop farming. Narkul wants to further increase her number of cattle, as eco-friendly milk is in high-demand among local residents. In connection with this, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" to request a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow with a calf. Narkul plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase the size of her herd. She also will make major repairs on her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and a calf.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio fue impulsada por su amiga para que generara ingresos vendiendo, boli (Congelado de frutas) paletas y chicha. Ella empezó congeando agua y poco a poco fue agregando los otros productos, para complacer a su clientela, esto fue hace 14 años y aun sus metas no se detienen, quiere producir en mayor volumen y vender de igual manera. Aunque trabaja desd elas 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche vendiendo entre sus vecinos y transeuntes, no es muy productiva y tiene pensado a futuro tener una heladería bien organizada. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comrpará un nuevo congelador, pues su mayor desafio es aumentar sus ventas y fidelizar su clientela actual y potencial, para finalmente generar ingresos y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en: Rocio was driven by a friend to generate income by selling boli (frozen fruit), ice cream and chicha. She began freezing water and little by little adding other products to please her customers. This was 14 years ago and her goals haven't stopped. She wants to produce and sell in greater quantities. Although she works from 8 in the morning until 8 at night, selling to neighbors and passerby, she isn't very productive and she plans in the future to have a well organized ice cream parlor. This is the reason why she has turned to a Kiva loan. This is the first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a new freezer. Her biggest challenge is to increase her sales and gain her customers' and potential customers' loyalty so that she can finally generate income and remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
Jose tiene 34 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolivar es casado y vive con su esposa y sus 6 hijo.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Ambrocio Laso que se deica a las labores agricolas.
 
Jose se dedica a la agricultura y siembra papas y habas, tambien cria animales.

El utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para sus siembras y para comprar animales para engordarles y luego venderles, con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar su propio terreno para asi incrementar su negocio.
El realiza las compras en la  ciudad de Chimbo cada semana, su sueños y metas que tiene es tener su propio negoció el nunca ha tenido  un desafió en los tiempos libres se dedica al deporte.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old and he  lives in the San Miguel canton, Bolivar province. He is married and he lives with his wife and their 6 children. He is a member of the Ambrocio Laso bank, which is dedicated to agricultural work. 
 
Jose works in agriculture and he grows potatoes and beans. He also raises animals. 

He will use the money from the loan to buy fertilizers for his crops and to buy animals to fatten up and later sell. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy his own land to grow his business.
 
He makes his purchases in the city of Chimbo every week. His dreams and goals are to have his own business. He hasn't had any challenges. In his free time, he plays sports.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten up and then sell.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Markus, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Markus  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Markus   With this loan, Markus is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en: Bashir is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Bashir joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Auwalu, Naziru, and Abubakar. Bashir is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Bashir will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Bashir can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Bashir said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family. Bashir is not thinking about just this year, he said: in 5 years, he wants to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 32 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolivar su estado civil es casado vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 1 año.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Ambrocio Laso que se dedican a las labores agricolas.
  
Luis se dedica a la agricultura y siembra Papas, utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de insumos agricolas con el apoyo del crédito puede comprar lo que sea necesario para la siembra de las papas. El realiza las compras en la ciudad de Chimbo todas las semanas, su sueño es seguir unido con su familia y ser muy feliz enfrentara los desafíos que se le presente en la vida. En los tiempos libres se dedica a la fundacion de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old and lives in the town of San Miguel in the province of Bolivar.  He is married and lives with his wife and three children ages 10, 7 and 1. He is a member of the cooperative Ambrocio Laso which focuses on agricultural labor.

Luis works in agriculture and grows potatoes.  He will use his loan to purchase agricultural products. With the loan he'll be able to buy what he needs to plant potatoes.  He makes purchases in the city of Chimbo every week.  His dream is to remain close to his family and to be happy even when facing the difficulties that life presents.  In his free time he works for the community foundation.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products.

loans.name: Talatu

texts.en: Talatu is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Talatu expressed that she is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Talatu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Talatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Talatu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Talatu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Talatu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гульзат, 48 лет, замужем. Имеет 4 детей (2 сына и 2 дочери). Семья очень дружная и уважаемая в селе. С 1992 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес начала с 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 7 дойных коров, 3 лошади, 1 жеребенок и 50 овец. Также у нее в наличии имеется земельный надел, где она ежегодно выращивает корма для скота. Ежемесячная прибыль Гульзат составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего своего хозяйства Гульзат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей. Дети и супруг помогают вести домашнее хозяйство. На доходы от кредита Гульзат планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также в будущем приобрести земли и построить на ней большой дом с садом и сараями для всей семьи.
texts.en: Gulzat is 48 year old and married. She has four children (two sons and two daughters). Her family is very close-knit and respected in their village. Since 1992, she has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business with 5,000 som (KGS). Today, she is a successful farmer with her own small farm, on which she has 7 dairy cows, 3 horses, 1 foal and 50 sheep. She also has on hand a plot of land, where she annually grows feed for her livestock. Gulzat's monthly income is up to 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her farm, Gulzat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy heifers. Her children and her husband help her run the farm. Gulzat plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase the size of her herd. She also intends to buy land and build a large house with a garden and barns on it for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 44 года, имеет 4 детей, замужем. Айнура в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур – кукурузы и картофеля, начав свой бизнес с 1995 года. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 дойные коровы, 10 овец, также есть 0,40 ГА поливной земли. Продажа молока, мяса, овощей приносит в месяц около 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки телят и овец. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также накопить средства на постройку большого и просторного дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Ainura is 44 years old, married and has four children. As the main source of income for her family, Ainura practices livestock breeding and crop farming - growing corn and potatoes. She started this business in 1995. Thanks to Ainura's hard work, she currently has 4 dairy cows and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as a 0.4 hectare plot of irrigated land. The sale of milk, meat and vegetables brings in about 4,000 som (KGS) a month. For the further development of her business, Ainura turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by purchasing calves and sheep. Ainura plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a large and spacious house for her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: Saidu is a dedicated farmer from Kaduna.  As a Babban Gona member, Saidu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Saidu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Saidu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 45 bags of maize per hectare this season. Saidu is hopeful about what the future holds.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Dulce Sinfonia Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas, y lo coordina la señora Melania de 43 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro hijos, por quienes se ha superado, se dedica a comercializar frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad, este negocio lo impulso con un préstamo que le hizo su esposo hace catorce años, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de calala, piña, sandia, naranja y naranja agrias, con el fin de ampliar más su negocio. Las otras socias son las señoras Juana de 50 años de edad comerciante de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad e invertirá en cosecha de mamón y aguacate, y Fátima de 22 años de edad comerciante de frutas y verduras en las calles de la municipalidad desde hace catorce años.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three hard-working partners. It is coordinated by Melania, who is 43 years old, married, and mother of 4 children for whom she strives to get ahead. She has decided to sell fruits in the market of the town. She started this business with a loan which her husband gave her 14 years ago, and she is asking for a loan now to buy passion fruits, pineapples, melons, oranges, and bitter oranges, in order to increase her business.

The other partners are Juana, 50 years old, who sells fruits in the market of the town  and will invest in the harvest of mamoncillo and avocados, and Fátima, 22 years old, who has sold fruits and vegetables in the streets of the town for 14 years.

loans.use: to buy fruits like passion fruit, pineapple, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells snacks at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, peas, baking flour, cassava and chips. She works for six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishability. She is aspiring of buying an electric deep fryer and fridge to serve her customers better. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest rates. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, peas, baking flour, cassava and chips.

loans.name: Yahaya Lado

texts.en: Yahaya Lado is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Yahaya Lado joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Obadiya,Manasa, and Felisha. Yahaya Lado is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Yahaya Lado will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Yahaya Lado can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Yahaya Lado is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ana Sara

texts.es:
Sara tiene 19 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar su estado civil es casada vive con su esposo y su hijo de 1 año.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Ambrocio Laso que se dedican a las labores agrícolas.
  
Sara se dedica a la agricultura y siembra Papas, utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y animales para engordarlos y venderlos con el apoyo del crédito puede comprar lo que sea necesario para la siembra de las papas y el alimento para los animales. El realiza las compras en la ciudad de Chimbo todas las semanas, su sueño es seguir unido con su familia y ser muy feliz enfrentara los desafíos como las plagas. En los tiempos libres se dedica a la fundación de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Sara is 19 years old and lives in the San Miguel province in Bolívar. She is married and lives with her husband and her one-year-old son. She's a member of the Ambrocio Laso group which works in farming. Sara works in agriculture planting potatoes. 

She will use the loan money to buy agricultural supplies and animals to fatten up and sell. With the loan support, she will be able to buy what's necessary to plant potatoes and to feed her animals. She makes all of her purchases in the city of Chimbo every week. Her dream is to keep connected with her family and to be really happy. She will face challenges such as pests. She devotes herself in her spare time to the foundation of the community.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten up

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en: La'azarus is a 50-year-old farmer from Galadima.  As a Babban Gona member, La'azarus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, La'azarus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, La'azarus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Gidiyan,Nashemiya, and Saloman. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells fresh maize and dry fish at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. She gets additional income from poultry farming from home. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of maize and beans. She works for six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the perishability of fish. She is aspiring of building more rooms for poultry farming. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest rates.  

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and cereals.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 14 Décembre 2012 et est composé de  femmes très actives dans  leurs activités génératrices a été rejoint par 05 nouvelles adhésions dans ce troisième cycle vu l’impact positif du banc villageois dans les conditions de vie des familles des membres. Les femmes vivent dans le même village et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Maimouna  (en médaillon en haut et à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants  (01 garçon et 01 fille). Elle est vendeuse de pâte d’arachide qu’elle achète à l’état auprès de femmes productrices pour la revente dans sa localité et les villages aux environs par détail. Elle a une parfaite maîtrise de ce type d’activité.  
  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle prévoit d’acheter 05 seaux de 5 kg pour 25 000 Fr CFA et de renouveler son approvisionnement tous les 15 jours.

Les bénéfices lui servent d’épargne d’une part et d’autre par à soutenir son mari dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 14, 2012, and is composed of women who are very active in their revenue-generating businesses. Five new members have joined the group for this third loan cycle because of the positive impact of the ’banc villageois’ on the family lives of members. The women live in the same village and get along well together. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Maimouna (in the upper-right cameo) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 43 years old and a married mother of two (a boy and a girl). She is a vendor of peanut butter, which she purchases as is from women producers, and then she resells it in her town and in the surrounding villages. She has mastered this type of business completely.

With this new loan, she plans on purchasing five 5-kg pails of peanut butter for 25,000 francs CFA and renewing her supplies every two weeks. 

The profits will in part go toward savings, as well as to supporting her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 5 pails of peanut butter and to renew her supplies every two weeks

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells used clothes on a retail basis and has been in this business for four years. She sells her clothes by moving door to door. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She works for six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transport costs, which affect her movement from one customer to another. 

She is aspiring of buying a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Gente De Zonas Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y coordinado por la señora Francisca de 31 años de edad, soltera y madre de un hijo, quien ha sido su motivación para seguir mejorando su condición de vida se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías en bambú, desde hace diez años, esta negocio lo impulso con ayuda de su mamá, debido a que ella le realizo un préstamo para que ella lo impulsara, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de varas de bambú, barniz, clavo, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras Raquel de 25 años de edad, comerciante de golosinas en los buses de la localidad, y Matilde de 45 años de edad, comerciante de frutas en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace doce años.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three enterprising women and is coordinated by Francisca. Francisca is 31 years old, single and mother of one son who is her motivation to improve her living conditions. For ten years, her business has been the manufacture and sale of bamboo craftwork. She started this business with the help of her mother, who gave her a loan to start the business.

She is now asking for a loan to buy bamboo sticks, varnish, nails, etc. 

The other partners are Raquel, 25 years old, who sells sweets on the buses of the town, and Matilde, 45 years old, who has sold fruits in the busiest market of the town for twelve years.

loans.use: to buy bamboo sticks, varnish, nails, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 53 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar su estado civil es casado vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 18, 16, 15 6 y 2 año.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Ambrocio Laso que se dedican a las labores agrícolas.
  
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura y siembra Papas y habas, utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas con el apoyo del crédito puede comprar lo que sea necesario para la siembra de las papas y habas. El realiza las compras en la ciudad de Chimbo todas las semanas, su sueño es ser muy feliz enfrentara los desafíos que se le presente en la vida. En los tiempos libres se dedica a la fundación de la comunidad y a tejer.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old and lives in the San Miguel province of Bolívar. She is married and lives with her husband and five children who are 18, 16, 15, 6 and 2 years old. She is a member of the Ambrocio Laso group which works in farming. Rosa works in agriculture, planting potatoes and fava beans. She will use the loan money to buy agricultural supplies. With the loan support she'll be able to buy what's necessary to plant potatoes and fava beans. She makes all of her purchases in the city of Chimbo every week. 

Her dream is to be really happy. She will face the challenges that life presents her. In her free time, she dedicates herself to the foundation of the community and to knitting.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 10 children, five of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). 

She operates a pub and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda and to load more money on her phone. She generates additional income from operating mobile money services and also sells spare parts. She works in a shop for seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  

She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked pub and also to become a big mobile money agent. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda, beer and spirits

loans.name: Majorine

texts.en:
Majorine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).  

She operates a retail shop and has been in this business for three years. She works for seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and small and medium jerrycans of cooking oil. She generates additional income from rental rooms. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring of owning a wholesale shop, buying a delivery van to ease transportation and also to build more rental rooms. 

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and small and medium jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a Babban Gona farmer from Dogon Fako. Abdu is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Abdu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abdu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Abdu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Abdu is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Abdu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo esta separado de su esposa pero tiene un hijo con el que vive en una casa alquilada de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja como chofer de radio taxi, con esta actividad se mantiene y cubre sus minimas necesidades. Necesita un crédito para reparar su vehiculo Recientemente Rodolfo recibió un choque, no fue su culpa y espimperativo que componga el vehiculo, caso contrario se queda sin ingresos Rodolfo no tiene a quien acudir por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Rodolfo is separated from his wife but has a son with whom he lives in a rented house in the city of La Paz. 
He currently works as a radio dispatched taxi driver and is able to support himself and cover his basic needs. Rodolfo needs a loan to repair his vehicle because it was recently hit by another car. It was not his fault, and he urgently needs to fix it, or he will have no way to make an income. Rodolfo has no one to turn to, so he needs your help.

loans.use: to fix his car, which was recently hit by another car.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana es soltera pero tiene dos hijos Ella vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a la madre de Roxana La actividad de Roxana es la venta de ropa y ella necesita un credito para comprar una mayor variedad de ropa Roxana es la unica fuente de ingresos estables en la casa por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Roxana is single but has two children. She lives with her parents in La Paz in an adobe house which belongs to her mother. Roxana sells clothing and she needs a loan to buy a greater variety of clothing. Roxana is the only stable source of income in the house, and because of this, she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothing

loans.name: Cossy

texts.en:
Cossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. 

She has a business of selling used clothes, and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works in a shop for seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and the ever increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda.  

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and brother). 

She operates a food stall and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, small jerrycans of cooking oil, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, cassava and cabbages. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.   

Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season. She is aspiring of investing in used clothes and also to build more rental houses. She has decided to join MCDT-SACCO so as to acquire more capital for her business.  

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy sweet potatoes, cassava, Irish potatoes and green bananas

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia Libia continua con su negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia continua elaborando desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Libia is continuing her restaurant business. She has had her business for a good amount of time and it is going well due to the effort that she gives to her business every day. She continues to make breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

She belongs to the "Sol Naciente de Mojopata" Communal Bank. She requests the loan to purchase supplies like rice, oil, and other things.

She is grateful for the loan and values it, and promises to make her monthly payments in a responsible manner.

The community of Mojopata is located in the Challabamba district in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like rice, oil, and other things.

loans.name: María Ínes

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de los dieciocho años, quedando viuda a los treinta y nueve, comenta que su esposo durante estuvo con ellos fue un hombre responsable con ella y sus hijos, tiene tres hijos, la hija menor esta su casa estudia su séptimo grado, los otros están ya fuera de núcleo trabajando en el extranjero. Actualmente solo vive con su hija de doce años, solo la niña depende de allá.      

María es vendedora de productos de revista (cosméticos, perfumes etc.) cuenta con una experiencia de seis años, una amiga le indujo a la actividad, considerando que con su esfuerzo lograría más ingresos a su hogar, ya que en la situación en la que quedo después que murió su esposo, era a ella a quien le tocaba toda la responsabilidad de los ingresos al hogar y la educación a su hija, no tiene otras actividades a la que se dedique, anteriormente hacía venta de pupusas y se iba a vender donde estaban construyendo una represa hidroeléctrica. Ella vende de casa en casa por toda la comunidad donde vive, la actividad la realiza ella sola, tiene un horario de 10:00 AM a 5:00 PM.

El préstamo será invertido en el pago de unas deudas que ha adquirido por la compra de mercadería, la cual ya vendió pero que no le han cancelado y ya le llegó la fecha de cancelación a ella, la mejora que el préstamo hará es el poder cancelar su compromiso y seguir trabajando.

 La necesidad satisfecha es el solventar su compromiso y no estancarse con sus proveedores. Mencionar, que anteriormente había tramitado crédito el cual lo invirtió de buena manera y hoy con la buena atención que se le dio y la facilidad de pago decide seguir trabajando con la institución.

Desea lograr ser una vendedora de prestigio y que su hija puada tener más oportunidades de estudio, que pueda ser una profesional es su sueño.
texts.en:
María is a 41-year old woman who studied up to sixth grade and got married when she was 18. Her husband, who was a responsible man with her and their children, passed away when she was 39. She has 3 children. Her youngest daughter lives at home and studies seventh grade, and the older ones are independent and work abroad. Therefore only her 12-year old daughter depends on her. 

María sells catalog products (cosmetics, perfumes, etc.) and has 6 years of experience. A friend motivated her into this activity as it would give her additional income for her household, something very needed after the death of her husband. She is responsible for the household income and the education of her daughter. In the past, she used to sell stuffed tortillas in the site where a hydroelectric dam was being built. She now sells door-to-door in the community where she lives and works from 10am to 5pm. 

She will use the loan to repay the debt she has from buying goods. Although the goods have been sold, she has not received payments yet. Thanks to the loan, she will meet her repayment obligations and keep working. She had a loan in the past, which she invested wisely, and today wants to work with the same institution after having received good customer service and good repayment conditions.

Her dream is to become a prestigious seller and to provide her daughter with more study opportunities so that she can become a professional.

loans.use: to cancel her debts from purchasing goods. Although these goods have been sold, she has not received payment and her cancellation deadline has arrived.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 42 года, имеет 3 детей, замужем. Образование у Динары среднее, работает лепщицей пельменей. Динара в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, полеводством, стартовав в 2009 году с 15,00 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Динары, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 1 бычок и 1 дойная корова. Ежемесячный доход  составляет примерно 5,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, а также она хочет выкупить из аренды дом, в котором проживает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en: Dinara is 42 years old, married and has three children. Dinara has a secondary education. She works as a pelmeni (dumpling) maker. As an additional source of income for her family, Dinara practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 2009 with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Dinara's hard work, she currently has 1 bull calf and 1 dairy cow on her farm. Her monthly income is about 5,500 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Dinara turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 40,000 som (KGS) to buy 2 bull calves and cattle feed. Dinara plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business. She also wants to buy the house that she currently rents, where she lives with her family.

loans.use: two bull calves and cattle feed.

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
