Por su avanzada edad se le ha hecho muy difícil conseguir trabajo por lo que su estadero de comida es la única fuente de ingreso para él y su esposa por dicha razón solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para realizar sus comidas como panes, servilletas, carne etc. 

El crédito para el señor Hernando es de vital importancia pro que es la oportunidad de seguir manteniendo su negocio, su estilo de vida y sobrevivir junto con su esposa.
texts.en:
Hernando is 60 years old, a veteran, and in a happy marriage. Six years ago he started a business selling fast foods, fried foods and  foods that are typical of the region.

Because of his age he has found it very difficult to get a job, so his restaurant is the only source of income for him and his wife. For that reason he is applying for a loan to purchase ingredients to make the food, such as bread, napkins, meat etc.

For Mr. Hernando, this loan is of vital importance because it is the opportunity to continue his business, his lifestyle and survive with his wife.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bread, meat, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a table and over sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa is a 40-year-old farmer from Ang/Dantani.  As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hauwa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Hauwa is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 40 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Hauwa is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children; Musa,  and  Rahama,. Hauwa’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new chainsaw and fencing wire and to pay for vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Ezekiel, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ezekiel is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family,” expressed Ezekiel . With this loan, Ezekiel is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 68-year-old married mother of four children. She operates a sewing shop which she is doing successfully. She is catering and selling to not only the members of her community but also to the members of the wider public as well. Her daughter assists her with her business. Even though she is an older woman, she is still strong and healthy enough to conduct her business. Elena has been with the SPBD program for more than five years and her good record, in terms of repayments and commitment to the program, is unquestionable. Her business has expanded so she needs a medium-sized loan not only to buy a new sewing machine and materials, but also iron roofing, timber, iron bars, and bricks for home improvement. With her profits she has been earning, Elena has managed to provide much better living standards for her family and she doesn't have to rely on other people to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, fabric materials, iron roofing, timber, iron bars, bricks

loans.name: Gregorio Geronimo

texts.es:
Gregorio es un hombre de 45 años de edad casado, padre de tres hijos y se dedica a la confección y venta de medias de temporada.
Él es una persona dedicada su trabajo, de carácter humilde, aprendió a confeccionar medias durante un curso de capacitación textil a un grupo de emprendedores con la idea de crear microempresa, su lugar de trabajo es en la ciudad de El Alto, lugar dónde las bajas temperaturas hacen de su emprendimiento un negocio rentable.
Gregorio es de tez morena, cabello corto y estatura mediana, su familia se encuentra presente en todo el proceso de producción, como; la compra de tela, confección y venta. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la zona 16 de julio un lugar muy comercial y su trabajo lo realiza de lunes a domingo. Sus sueños giran alrededor de su trabajo; vender por mayor y distribuir su mercadería a todo el país.
Sus hijos se dedican al mismo negocio, el mayor terminó la escuela secundaria, estudia corte y confección y ya sigue los mismos pasos que su padre, los hijos menores aún se encuentran en la escuela pero ya tienen experiencia en la costura.
Es por esos motivos que Gregorio solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos y telas y así mejorar el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 45, is married and the father of three children.  He is dark skinned, has short hair, and is of average height.  He's dedicated to his work and is a person of modest character.  

Gregorio earns a living making and selling seasonal socks.  He learned to make socks in a textile training class for a group of entrepreneurs, with the idea of creating a micro-business.  He works in the city of El Alto, where the low temperatures make his undertaking a profitable business.

His family is present throughout the entire production process, such as fabric purchasing, manufacturing, and sales.  His business is located in the very commercial 16 de Junio area, and he works from Monday through Sunday.  His dreams revolve around his work: selling wholesale and distributing his merchandise nationwide.

His children work in the same business.  The eldest finished secondary school and is studying tailoring and fashion design, following in his father's footsteps.  The younger children are still in school but already have sewing experience.

For these reasons Gregorio is requesting a loan to buy thread and fabric to improve the family business.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric to improve the family business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies such as fertilizers and light pesticides to help his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an industrial cooker for her business

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose tiene 34 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar su estado civil es casado vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 12, 9 7 y 3 año.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Ambrocio Laso que se dedican a las labores agrícolas.
  
Jose se dedica a la agricultura siembra Papas, utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas con el apoyo del crédito puede comprar lo que sea necesario para la siembra de las papas y asi incrementar el negocio. El realiza las compras en la ciudad de Chimbo todas las semanas, su sueño es seguir unido con su familia y ser muy feliz enfrentara los desafíos que se le presente en la vida. En los tiempos libres se dedica al deporte y a la fundación de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old and lives in cantón San Miguel in Bolívar Province. He is married and lives with his wife and 4 children aged 12, 9, 7 and 3. He is a member of the Laso Ambrosio group of agricultural workers.
  
Jose makes a living in agriculture. He grows potatoes. He will use the money from the loan to purchase fertilizers. With the support of the loan, he can buy what is needed for planting potatoes and thus increasing business. He sells potatoes in the city of Chimbo every week. His dream is to stay close with his family and to be very happy in the face of challenges that comes his way in life. His free time is devoted to sports and the community foundation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 24-year-old farmer from Kargo.  As a Babban Gona member, Daniel , is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Daniel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Daniel is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Daniel said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Victor, Musa,  and  Samaila,, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en:
Itagia, age 45, operates a small barbecue business to earn her living. She prepares and sells barbecued food to people in her community and to traveling members of the general public. She has been a member of SPBD for more than five years, and she has managed to better provide for her family's essential needs with the increased profits she has made from her business.

Itagia and her husband have three children.

At present, she does not have a permanent shelter or stall for her business, which is near the airport. She plans to use her loan funds to purchase iron roofing, cement, and timber to build a shelter for her business. She will also purchase bottled gas to use in food preparation. 

Improving her place of business will protect her from the weather and allow her to work within a permanent shelter.

loans.use: to purchase iron roofing, cement, and timber to build a shelter for her business

loans.name: Dúo Las Rosas Group

texts.es: Este dúo está conformado por Olga de 32 años de edad,es originarias de Sumpango, y es madre de familia,  doña Olga se dedica a la venta de Atol y refacciones en el mercado local de Sumpango, además también se dedica a preparar distintos platillos para vender en el mercado local, ella necesita un crédito para pode invertir en su negocio ya que todos lo ingrediente que necesita están demasiados caros y por lo mismo es que solicita un crédito es la primera vez que lo hacen y prometen pagar puntualmente en cada pago, para poder tener la oportunidad de seguir creciendo con los créditos que kiva da.
texts.en:
This duo is made up Olga who is 32 years of age and is from Sumpango. She is the mother of the family. Olga makes a living by selling atol [cornflour drink] and refreshments in Sumpango’s local market.  She also makes a living preparing different dishes to sell in the local market. 

She needs a loan so that she can invest in her business since all the ingredients she needs are too expensive. For this reason she is requesting a loan. This is the first time they have done it and they promise to make each payment promptly in order to have the opportunity to continue growing with the loans Kiva gives. 
.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the production and sale of refreshments

loans.name: Solomon Dauda

texts.en: Solomon Dauda remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Solomon Dauda, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Solomon Dauda  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Solomon Dauda   With this loan, Solomon Dauda is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Rahila Yakubu

texts.en: Rahila Yakubu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Rahila Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her  children: Manasseh, Tambaya, and  Laraba.. Rahila Yakubu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Rahila Yakubu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Rahila Yakubu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Rahila Yakubu is not thinking about this year alone; she expressed that his longterm goal is to “move to the city with my family”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Carolina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Carolina del Socorro es una señora de 45 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos que están en edad escolar.
Originaria del municipio de El Sauce proveniente de una familia ganadera pero para salir adelante estudió Magisterio es decir para maestra de primaria, profesión que ha ejercido por más de diez años y que le ha ayudado en conjunto con su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos y a tener su propia casa.
Doña Carolina imparte clases de primaria en una escuela de la comunidad Las Mercedes donde a diario tiene que viajar en bicicleta 15 kilómetros para estar puntual en su centro de trabajo.
Debido a problemas de salud doña Carolina se presentó a Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento para cubrir gastos como compra de medicamentos y realización de exámenes.
Se dio cuenta a través de una amiga de los inversionistas Kiva que apoyan a las personas de escasos recursos por este motivo se presentó para que le apoyen, ya que necesita mucho de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Carolina del Socorro is a 45 year-old-woman who is married and the mother of three school-age children. She is from the town of El Sauce from a farming family. However in order to get ahead she studied teaching, namely, elementary education. She has practiced this profession for more than ten years and it has helped her, together with her husband, in getting their children ahead and owning their own home. Carolina teaches elementary classes in a school in the community of Las Mercedes where daily she has to travel 15 kilometers by bike in order to be on time to her workplace.  

Because of health problems Carolina was introduced to Ceprodel while in search of funding to cover expenses such as purchasing medicine and conducting tests. She became aware of the Kiva investors and their support for low-income individuals through a friend. For this reason she came to receive their support since she very much needs this funding.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and conduct tests

loans.name: Yakubu Philibus

texts.en: Yakubu Philibus remembers not being able to repair his home.  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Yakubu Philibus, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yakubu Philibus  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Yakubu Philibus   With this loan, Yakubu Philibus is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendredora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes.

Don Julián  de 76 años, quien vive en Sololá, casado, y con un hijo quien trabaja por cuenta propia posee una cantidad de terreno para dedicarse a la agricultura, una actividad extra para don Julián, ya que trabajó en una institución pública durante 25 años, y ahora es jubilado.

Sin embargo, don Julián sabe que la tierra que lo vió nacer, le pide que la cuide con la ternura de un agricultor.  Sembrando papas y otros productos sabe don Julián que asegura el futuro de su familia y demás generaciones.

Para eso Julián ha solicitado un préstamo como factor principal que seguir asegurando ese futuro tan esperanzador para sus generaciones por venir
texts.en:
Farming is suitable work only for those people who love the earth as a mother, a creator of futures for life, good futures with hope for the generations to come.

Julián, 76, who lives in Sololá, is married and has one child who works on his own.  He has some land for farming, an extra job, because Julián's retired now after working in a public institution for 25 years.

Nevertheless, Julián knows that the land he was born to asks to be taken care of with a farmer's tenderness.  He knows that by growing potatoes and other crops he's securing the future for his family and other generations.

For that reason Julián requested a loan as a major way to keep on securing that future that is so inspiring for his future generations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Delia Enriqueta

texts.es:
Delia tiene 22 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar su estado civil es casado vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Ambrocio Laso que se dedican a las labores agrícolas.
  
Delia se dedica a la agricultura siembra Papas y maiz, utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas con el apoyo del crédito puede comprar lo que sea necesario para la siembra. Ella realiza las compras en la ciudad de Chimbo todas las semanas, su sueño es seguir unido con su familia y ser muy feliz enfrentara los desafíos que se le presente en la vida. En los tiempos libres se dedica a la fundación de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Delia is 22 years old and lives in the canton of San Miguel in the province of Bolívar. She is married and she and her husband have 2 children aged 4 and 2 years.

She is a member of the Laso Ambrosio bank branch. She is a farmer. Delia is engaged in agriculture, planting potatoes and corn. She will use the money from this loan to purchase agricultural inputs which will support the purchase of what she needs for planting. She will make purchases in the city of Chimborazo every week. Her dream is to keep connected to her family, be very happy, and face the challenges that come her way in life. In her free time she is active in the community.

loans.use: to plant corn and potatoes

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a 41-year-old woman with 4 children. She runs a small plantation and vegetable garden business, selling her produce to the members of her community and also to the members of the traveling public. She plans to use this loan to purchase a wheelbarrow, fork pitch, rakes, vegetable seeds for her business, and cement, timber, iron roofing for her home renovation. She has been a member of SPBD for more than 3 years and is continuing to improve the livelihood of her family with the profits she earns from her business, especially meeting her kids' educational expenses and the family's daily essential needs.

loans.use: buy equipment for her business and renovate her home

loans.name: Folototo

texts.en: Folototo is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children. She wants to start a small pancake business to help with her family's finances, thus the reason why she has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to sell her pancakes to the members of her community. With this money, she plans to purchase sacks of flour, cooking oil, sacks of sugar, baking powder, and kerosene for her cooking stove so that she would have all the ingredients to start up her business. She hopes to save a lot of her profit so that she would be able to assist in the daily essential needs of her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: start a pancake selling business

loans.name: Fabricio Alejandro

texts.es:
Fabricio es un hombre de 28 años de edad soltero, sin hijos, estudia y trabaja como asistente de consultoría legal.
Él es una persona sencilla, estudiosa con muchos sueños y metas por cumplir como; la principal es ser profesional y dedicarse a ejercer su carrera, sus estudios los realiza por la noche en la universidad pública, durante el día se ocupa de su trabajo, no tiene tiempo para actividades extras como el deporte o la diversión.
Fabricio es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, tiene dos hermanos menores a los cuales ayuda a pagar sus estudios en la escuela secundaria. Él tiene necesidades como; material de estudio, libros y muchas fotocopias diarias pero su principal necesidad es la computadora, actualmente utiliza la computadora de su trabajo (cuando tiene tiempo), pero los fines de semana no tiene acceso a ella.
Su rutina diaria es muy sencilla, se levanta por la mañana, se dirige a su trabajo de ocho horas diarias y por la noche asiste a la universidad de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana tiene muchas tareas universitarias y se ve imposibilitado de realizarlas, debe recurrir a amigos, vecinos y familiares para prestarse computadora para poder estudiar.
Es por esos motivos que Fabricio solicita un préstamo para la compra de una laptop para estudiar y cumplir sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Fabricio is a 28-year old man, single and without children. He studies and works as a legal consultant's assistant. He is a simple person, studious, and with many dreams and goals to achieve. The primary one is to be a professional and to focus on practicing his profession. He studies at night at the public university. During the day, he stays busy with his job. He doesn't have time for extra activities such as sports or fun.

Fabricio has a dark complexion, short black hair, and medium build. He has two younger brothers whose secondary school tuition he helps to pay.

He has needs such as: studying material, books, and a lot of daily photocopies, but his main need is the computer. He currently uses the computer at work (when he has time), but he doesn't have access to it during the weekends.

His daily routine is very simple: he gets up in the morning, he heads to work for eight hours a day, and at night, he goes to the university from Monday to Friday. On the weekends, he has a lot of homework, and he has been prevented from doing it. He has to turn to friends, neighbors, and relatives to loan him a computer so that he can study.

For these reasons, Fabricio is applying for a loan to buy a laptop to study and achieve his goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to study and achieve his goals and dreams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and make a corral.

loans.name: Mujeres Guapas Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con trabajos variados, cada una de ellas son muy luchadoras y emprendedoras que quieren que sus familias tengan todo lo que necesitan.
Mayra es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas que hace de manera ambulante, ella quiere que su grupo trabaje unido para poder lograr el crecimiento de cada una de ellas por medio de su esfuerzo.
Mayra pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, ya que la temporada de frío esta cerca y quiere poder tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this group have different work activities, each of them is hardworking and entrepreneurial and want their families to have everything they need.
Mayra is the president of the group, she sells different types of clothing, she wants the group to work together to be able to achieve growth for each through the group’s effort.
Mayra requests the loan to buy a variety of clothing for sale, the cold season is near and she wants to have good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
Tasi is a 71-year-old married woman with 6 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Tasi needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a chest freezer, foam cups and a large spoon. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Tasi just became a member of SPBD this year.

loans.use: buy supplies for her ice cakes business

loans.name: Seumalo

texts.en:
Seumalo is a 36-year-old mother of 5 children. She runs a small plantation where she sells her produce to the people around her community, traveling public, or even in town. She also weaves and sells handicrafts as another means of making money. Seumalo plans to use this money to purchase a mist blower, chemicals, fencing wire, taro roots, taamu roots, blades for her plantation business, and to pay school fees for her children's education. 

Seumalo has been with the SPBD program for more than 3 years and has managed to improve her family's living standards with the profits she continues to make from her business.

loans.use: buy farm tools and supplies

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is a 33-year-old divorcee with 4 children. She runs a small business selling ava and ice blocks to the people around her community, especially ice blocks to the school kids, and her ava are sometimes delivered to the neighbouring villages shops or are sold at the markets in town. Her children help her out, and if there is a lot of work to be done she hires laborers to assist with the work. She plans to use this money to purchase an ava masher, knives, blade sharpener, mist blower, and chemicals for her ava business. 

Though she is a single mom, Kalala has managed to take care of her children without depending on other people for financial assistance through the business she is operating.  Kalala hopes to make a lot of profit from her business and be able to save so that she would continue to take care of her children without having to rely on others.

loans.use: buy tools and supplies for her ava drink business

loans.name: Tavae

texts.en:
Tavae is a 33-year-old woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she sells her crops to get extra money to help out with her family's finances during the week. She plans to use this loan to purchase a mist blower, chemicals, bush knives, spades, and fencing wire to improve her business.

Tavae has found that though she is doing well, there are times when she finds it hard to make enough profit from her business. Thus some of the times her partner fishes so that they can have another means of earning money other than the plantation business. She hopes that she would be able to save more of her profits so that she would be able to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: buy tools and supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Mataniu

texts.en:
Mataniu is a 25-year-old woman who is married with 2 children. She runs a business selling elei prints in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Mataniu has requested a loan to buy traditional design, color paint, brushes, fabric materials, etc. for her business. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy fabric prints supplies

loans.name: Vaiema

texts.en: Vaiema is a 46-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. She runs a business selling elei prints in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Vaiema has requested a loan to buy a color paint, fabric materials, traditional designs, etc. for her business.  She plans to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy supplies for her fabric business

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en: Valelia is 19 years old and single with no children.  She runs a small business selling popcorn in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Valelia has requested a loan to buy a gas oven, corn seeds, cooking oil, etc. for her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital.   Valelia will use her earnings to support her family.

loans.use: but supplies for her popcorn business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies for her pancake business

loans.name: Agustin Rodrigo

texts.es:
Agustin tiene 49 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar su estado civil es casado vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 13,8 y 27 años.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Ambrocio Laso que se dedican a las labores agrícolas.
  
Agustin se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas y habas, utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas con el apoyo del crédito puede comprar lo que sea necesario para la siembra. El realiza las compras en la ciudad de Chimbo todas las semanas, su sueño es seguir unido con su familia y ser muy feliz enfrentara los desafíos que se le presente en la vida. En los tiempos libres se dedica a jugar boli y a la fundación de la comunidad.
texts.en: Agustin is 49 years old. He live in the country of San Miguel in the province of Bolívar. He is married and he lives with his wife and his 3 children who are 13, 8, and 27 years old. He is a member of the community bank Ambrocio Laso which works with farmers. Agustin is a farmer who grows potatoes and lima beans. He will use the money from the loan to buy agricultural products that he will need to plant. He makes his purchases in the city of Chimbo every week. His dream is to continue being with his family and be very happy despite the challenges that life brings. In his free time, he plays ecuavolley and working with the community's foundation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Ciudad Nueva Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ciudad Nueva, esta en su ciclo numero 20, es un grupo muy antiguo que viene trabajando de forma unida, luchando por sus familias, estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elvira quien a trabes del trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo y por medio de la venta de gallina, huevo, y queso que hace, esta luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, que es por quienes esta luchando.
La Sra. Elvira solicita este préstamo para la compra de Alimentos para gallinas ponedoras, vitaminas y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y mas venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Ciudad Nueva [New City] is in its 20th cycle. It is a very old group that have been working together, fighting for their families. They are completing the Elimination of Poverty Survey that will enable each one of them to understand her situation and work accordingly.

One of the members is Señora Elvira.  She is fighting to improve her living conditions and those of her family—who are those for whom she is fighting—by working and striving, and by selling hens, eggs, and cheese that she makes. 

Señora Elvira is requesting this loan for the purchase of feed for laying hens, vitamins, and other items, which will help her to obtain more production and more sales; and this will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase feed for laying hens, vitamins, and other items.

loans.name: El Angelito Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Angelito lo integran tres socios emprendedores y es coordinado por la señora María Teresa de 44 años de edad, acompañada y madre de cinco hijos, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva tanto en su comunidad como en la capital, y solicita el crédito para la compra de camisetas, jean para damas, jean para caballeros, faldas, shorts, talladores, ropa interior, etc. Otra de las socias es la señora Mireya de 34 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de artesanías y cosméticos en los mercado capitalinos y en su comunidad desde hace cuatro años, y el señor Eduardo de 33 años de edad, comerciante de artesanías en su comunidad y propietario de una mecánica en su domicilio desde hace trece años.
texts.en:
The Angelito communal bank is comprised of three enterprising members.  María Teresa, age 44, is the coordinator.  She is in a relationship, and she has five children.  She sells new clothes as much in her community as in the capital.

She is requesting the loan to buy t-shirts, women’s jeans, men’s jeans, skirts, shorts, work clothes, and underwear, etc.

Mireya, age 34, is another member.  She has been selling handicrafts and cosmetics at the markets in the capital and in her community for four years.

Eduardo, age 33, sells handicrafts in his community, and he has had a mechanic’s shop at his house for thirteen years.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, women’s jeans, men’s jeans, skirts, shorts, work clothes, and underwear, etc.

loans.name: Perseverante Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario perseverante lo integran cuatro socios laboriosos y lo coordina la señora Ana de 25 años de edad y acompañada, quien se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva en el mercado más populoso de la capital, este negocio lo impulso hace seis años con ayuda de su mamá quien le hizo un préstamo. La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de camisetas, talladores, brazier, bóxer, blúmer, jean klua, jean lee, vestidos, short, faldas, etc., con el objetivo de tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a la población. Otro de los socios es la señora Rosa de 55 años de edad, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, comercializándolos en la capital, el señor Gustavo de 44 años de edad, quien se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas desde hace veinte años, y el señor Pedro de 35 años de edad, propietario de una caponera y ofrece el servicio de transporte en su comunidad desde hace más de dos años.
texts.en:
This dedicated group is made up of four hardworking members coordinated by 25-year old Sra. Ana. She is married and earns her living selling new clothing in the busiest market in the capital city. She started the business six years ago with help from her mother who loaned her some money. Now Ana is seeking a loan to buy shirts, sports shirts, bras, boxer shorts, underwear, different makes of jeans, dresses, shirts, skirts etc. so she has a greater variety of clothing to offer her customers.

The other members of the group are 55-year old Rosa who makes and sells tamales; 44-year old Gustavo who has bought and sold produce for twenty years; and 35-year old Pedro who owns a motorcycle taxi which he has used to transport people around for more than two years.

loans.use: buy shirts, sports shirts, bras, boxer shorts, underwear, different makes of jeans, dresses, shirts, skirts etc

loans.name: Ikatu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ikatu se encuentra muy animado para poder seguir trabajando y luchando. Son 20 mujeres muy unidas que se están esforzando por poder mejorar sus vidas, por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Son mujeres jefas de familia, donde una de ellas es Andrea, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, por medio de este trabajo luchan para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y tener mejores ingresos, y procurar que a ellos no les falta nada.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group, called Ikatu, is very excited to be able to keep working hard. There are 20 women, who are very close to each other, they are making all the efforts to improve their lives through team work.

They are head of households, one of them is Andrea, and she sells clothing articles. With this job, they struggle to be able to help their families, and to get a better income so they can cover their basic needs. 
She is requesting this loan to purchase several clothing articles, this way she´ll be able to keep selling them, working hard to improve her income, and her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy several clothing articles to sell.

loans.name: Apaua

texts.en: Apaua is a 39-year-old married woman with 4 children. She operates a small retail shop in her village. She joined the SPBD program in 2012 to gain access to financial assistance and has found that it has helped her a lot. With this money, she plans to purchase sugar, flour, rice, boxes of canned fish, corned beef, milk, onions, noodles, onion, biscuits, snacks, chicken leg quarters, etc. to restock her shop. Apaua hopes to make a lot of profit from her shop and be able to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, rice, boxes of canned fish, corned beef, milk, onions, noodles, onions, biscuits, snacks, chicken leg quarters, etc.

loans.name: Lealao

texts.en: Lealao is a 54-year-old widow with 8 children. She has a small farm where she raises pigs that she can sell in her community or to the public. She has been doing this for 4 years. Lealao needs a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food and a new wooden tub for water. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Lealao will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food and a new wooden tub for water.

loans.name: Mujeres De Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de Santa Inés está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de cada una, están mejorando cada vez  más.
Marcelina es una de las que integran este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de confecciones y de muy buena calidad, es conocida por su buen trabajo y ya tiene muy buena clientela. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus confecciones, y su trabajo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Santa Ana (Women of Santa Ana) group is in its second loan cycle of the women's program in which all members work together and help each other to get ahead. Their goal is to eliminate poverty, and thanks to the effort of each woman, they are gradually improving their lives.

Marcelina is a member of the group. She earns her living as a seamstress and makes all types of quality clothing. She is well known for her skills and already has a very good customer base. She is seeking a loan to buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons, etc. so she can continue her sewing business. She is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan.

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons etc.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: Silvia de 43 años de edad  vive con su compañero de vida y sus 5 hijos: 4 niñas de 17, 10, 7 y 3 años, además un varón de 6 meses. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado mantener su negocio desde hace 5 años en el cual tiene a disposición de su clientela una gran variedad de prendas de vestir tales como: blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, etc. Además  aprovecha a su clientela vendiendo productos por catálogo, también vende zapatos. Silvia desea colocar techo a su corredor por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines, pernos, arena y cemento para construir el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 43, lives with her life partner and their five children.  There are four girls, ages 17, 10, 7, and 3, and a six month old boy.  She is an enterprising woman who has managed to maintain her business for five years.  She has a great variety of garments available to her customers.  She has things like blouses, skirts, pants, t-shirts, and dresses, etc.

She also takes advantage of having her clientele in order to sell products by catalog.  She also sells shoes.

Silvia wishes to place a roof over her patio.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting, beams, bolts, sand, and cement in order to build a covered patio for her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, beams, bolts, sand, gravel, and cement.

loans.name: Flora Argentina

texts.es: Doña Flora es una mujer emprendedora de 50 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, se ha dedicado a la venta de refresco, frutas y huevos en los sectores aledaños a su comunidad desde hace ocho años y solicita el crédito para la compra de melón, papaya, granadilla, Jamaica, cajillas de huevos jumbos. La socia lleva 12 ciclos trabajando en la Institución y ha demostrado ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en: Flora is an enterprising 50 year-old woman.  She lives with a partner and is the mother of 2 children.  She's had a business selling beverages, fruits, and eggs in the neighborhoods surrounding her community for 8 years.  Flora is requesting a loan to buy melons, papayas, passion fruit, and cartons of large eggs.  Flora has been through 12 loan cycles with this institution, and she has shown herself to be a hardworking and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy fruits and cartons of eggs to sell

loans.name: Naikarra Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a restaurant owner in Naikarra, a town that is about two hours’ drive from the national grid power in Kenya. He has a wife and three children: two boys and a girl, who study at the neighboring school. For his restaurant, Joseph has a small solar system that he uses to power his television set. The presence of the television attracts many customers especially during the night, when people are interested in watching the news. Unfortunately, his solar system is not big enough to power his television all evening, causing him to lose customers and revenue. For lighting, he uses small dry cell battery and kerosene powered lamps which are expensive and do not provide adequate lighting for his family and business needs. 

The presence of a solar powered micro-grid in Naikarra will allow the residents to run their businesses longer, more efficiently, and in a healthy environment. Their businesses will now be free from the smoky kerosene lamps, noisy generators, dim candles, and the inefficient DC solar systems that they currently use. As for Joseph, he will be able to keep his restaurant open later, offer phone charging services, and provide cold beverages to his customers. He plans to take his children to a better school, expand his restaurant, and open a lodging with his increased profits.

In addition to Joseph, the micro-grid will serve fourteen other customers. They are Kanasa, James, Cecilia, Alex, Eric, Khadija, Adan, Ali, Meeyu, Habiba, Maria, Nuney, Charles, and Vincent. They all look forward to increased economic activity in the town through the efficient and affordable energy the micro-grid will bring.

loans.use: to connect to the solar micro-grid in Naikarra, enabling him to attract more customers to his restaurant and earn additional income for his family.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is a 48-year-old married woman with 9 children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Mareta has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Mareta hopes to use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Faalo

texts.en: Faalo is 54 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, chicken, onions, etc. She has been doing this for 3 years. Faalo needs a loan to buy a freezer, bags of sugar, boxes of noodles, bags of onions, chicken, etc. She also wants to expand her business. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, bags of sugar, boxes of noodles, bags of onions, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Loua

texts.en: Loua is 45 years old and a married woman with 6 children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes and cucumbers, etc. in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, etc. She joined SPBD in 2000 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Loua will love to continue running her business for the best improvement of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, a weed sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a small business of selling cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbages, etc in her community and has been doing this for three years. Loreta has requested a loan to buy seeds, a weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, etc. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Loreta will love to continue doing her business to improve her family's development.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, a weed sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en: After few months of absence cause of full time works,Franklin is now available and coming back to us to take his fourth loan to continue his entrepreneurship with EarthSpark/EnejiPwop. With this loan he will continue to purchase solar desk lamps,improved cookstoves and small solar home systems.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Mal. Idi

texts.en: Mal. Idi is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Mal. Idi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Ashiru, Mashakuru, and  Rabiu. Mal. Idi is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Mal. Idi will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Mal. Idi can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Mal. Idi is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Faapisa

texts.en: Faapisa is a 52-year-old married woman with 3 children. She owns and operates a large canteen in the local village school. She also owns a large plantation to earn extra income. Faapisa needs a loan to purchase 2 large display fridges, a new chest freezer, snacks and cases of soft drinks for her canteen, as well as chemicals and fertilizer for her plantation and new gum boots and overalls for the workers. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also pay for her grandchildren's education. Faapisa joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase 2 large display fridges, a new chest freezer, snacks and cases of soft drinks for her canteen, as well as chemicals and fertilizer for her plantation and new gum boots and overalls for the workers.

loans.name: Peata

texts.en: Peata is a 54-year-old married woman with 8 children. She runs a business of sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Peata has requested a loan to buy materials, threads, needles, a sewing machine, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads, needles, a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Fiaputa

texts.en: Fiaputa is a 35-year-old married woman with 9 children. She runs a small business selling cucumbers and tomatoes, etc. in her community and has been doing this for more than 3 years. Fiaputa has requested a loan to buy seeds, a weed sprayer, chemicals, etc. She joined SPBD in 2000 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fiaputa hopes her business will provide a good income for the family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, a weed sprayer, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es: María de 56 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija de 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace 15 años elaborando y distribuyendo una gran variedad de dulces artesanales como: melcochas, batidos, conserva, etc. además esta laboriosa mujer tiene una pequeña venta de pupusas los fines de semana en su domicilio, también su esposo aporta con su trabajo de elaboración de prendas de vestir para hombre. María desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, grava, cemento, ladrillo y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra para la construcción de dicho cuarto.
texts.en:
56-year old María lives with her husband and 14-year old daughter. She is an enterprising woman who has earned her living for fifteen years making and selling a wide variety of traditional sweets such as melcochas, batidos, conserva etc. This hardworking woman also sells stuffed tortillas at weekends from her house. Her husband also contributes through his business making men's clothing.

María wishes to add another room to their house so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy sand, gravel, cement, bricks and rebar. She will also need to hire laborers to build the room.

loans.use: Buy building supplies such as cement, sand, gravel, rebar and bricks, and hire laborers to build a room on her house

loans.name: Ramiro Jose

texts.es:
Al hablar de Ramiro se puede evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.

El vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de Valencia, Córdoba donde convive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.

El se gana la vida con la compra y venta de zapote y aguacate alrededor del municipio y tiene plena fe en su negocio.

Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de sus hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de aguacates y zapotes parta aumentar su capital de trabajo, de esta manera podrá tener un amplio inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes al por mayor.

El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario.

Al prestar a este crédito estarás apoyando a un emprendedor Colombiano con gran pujanza y corazón humilde.
texts.en:
Talking about Ramiro, it is evident that he is a hard working and helpful man. Everything he does is for his family’s wellbeing. He lives in a modest house with his wife and 5 children, in the municipality of Valencia, Cordoba. He has struggled to offer them a decent life and a good quality education.

He makes a living buying and selling sapota and avocado in the area. He completely believes in his business. He is a hard working and tenacious individual who loves his children.

He is requesting the loan to buy avocado and sapota to increase his work, that way he’ll be able to have them in stock to sell them wholesale to his customers. He hopes he can find help from caring people. Contributing to this loan, you’ll be helping a very driven and humble Colombian entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy sapota and avocado to supply his business.

loans.name: Los Del Sector Quino Group

texts.es:
Las calles de Quiché es testigo de los colores más vistosos impregnados en las blusas y fajas típicas.  Es imposible que cualquier turista deje de admirar este producto, pararse y hacer una buena compra de ello.

Juana ha sido responsable de esta atracción turística. (en la foto, se encuentra en medio de las tres que están sentadas en el piso trabajando en el telar, con hilo azúl.)   De 22 años, casada y con una niña de tres años, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de blusas y fajas típicas por varios años.  Además de tener una venta de pollos para engordar.
,
Es por ello que es parte de un grupo de personas que tienen el mismo oficio para poder apoyarse en la venta y diversificación del producto, y añadir una venta de artesanías.  Entonces poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes como personales. 

Es por esta razón por la que Juana solicita un que la ayude a tener una mayor satisfacción en su negocio.
texts.en:
The streets of Quiché are witness to the most attractive colors that permeate the typical blouses and belts.  It is impossible for any tourist to not admire this product, to stop, and to make a good purchase.

Juana has been responsible for this tourist attraction (in the photo she is in the middle of the three that are sitting on the floor weaving with blue thread).  She is 22 years old, married, and has a three year old daughter.  She has been making and selling typical blouses and belts for several years.  She also has a business of selling chickens to fatten.

That is why she is part of a group of people who engage in the same trade.  She is part of the group so that they can support each other in sales and the diversification of the product and to add the sale of handicrafts.  Then they will be able to satisfy their customers’ needs and their personal needs.

That is the reason that Juana is requesting a loan to help her have greater satisfaction in her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make typical embroideries.

loans.name: Soama

texts.en: Soama is 43 years old and a married woman with 4 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan to buy fishing net, spears, a torch and goggles, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Soama will pay for her children's education and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, spears, a torch and goggles, etc.

loans.name: Melea

texts.en: Melea is a 39-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows cucumbers, cabbages and tomatoes, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Melea has requested a loan to buy seeds, bush knives, a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow and chemicals, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Melea hopes to pay for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow and chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Reina Veronica

texts.es: Reina de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo. Ella es una mujer tenaz que 3 días a la semana compra leche de vaca para procesarla y sacar de ella: queso fresco, crema y requesón los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante en el mercado central, además su esposo aporta a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo. Reina desea construir un corredor cerrado frente a su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, lámina, polines y pernos además deberá pagar mano de obra para dicha construcción.
texts.en: Reina, 41, lives in her own home with her husband.  She is a tenacious woman who goes 3 days a week to buy cow's milk to process.  She uses the milk to make fresh cheese, cream, and cottage cheese, which she distributes in a temporary post in the central market.  In addition, her husband contributes to the household finances through his work.  Reina wants to build a covered patio in the front of her home, and so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, sheets of corrugated metal, beams, and bolts, and also to pay for labor to carry out the construction.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy printing machines, and industrial printer,   T-shirts, and merchandise related to anime

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a Babban Gona farmer from Hari. Samaila expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Samaila to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Samaila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Samaila, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Samaila will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland." With this loan, Samaila will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa de 34 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer tenaz que tras la pérdida de su compañero de vida ha logrado salir adelante por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras de temporada la cual distribuye de forma ambulante en el mercado central, además cría y vende gallinas. Tomasa desea construir un baño en su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillo, además pagará mano de obra para dicha construcción
texts.en: Tomasa is 34 years old and lives with her family. She is a tenacious woman who after losing her life partner has managed to get ahead in life selling fruits and vegetables, which she sells as a street vendor in the central market.She also raises and sells chickens. Tomasa wishes to build a bathroom in her home, for which she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, gravel, iron and bricks, and to pay for the labor needed in the construction.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and bricks, and to pay for labor to buy a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província De Inhambane, tem 37 anos idade é solteira mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 é que frequentam a escola. Não responsabiliza- se por ninguém
Trabalha na saúde como defensora de saúde. E negociante a mais de 5 anos tem vendido sapatos usados no Mercado informal vulgo shoprite, duas vezes por semana aos sábados e quartas-feiras. Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo fardos de sapatos, Este é seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
 Futuramente Pretende construir dependências em sua casa para o aluguer e tem como desafio  ser empreendedora de grande sucesso ao nível do distrito.
texts.en:
Margarida was born in Massinga, in the Inhambane province of Mozambique. She is 37 years old and is an single mother with four children, 3 of whom are in school. She doesn't provide for anyone else besides her children. 

Margarida works as a healthcare promoter and for more than five years she's also worked two days a week, Wednesdays and Saturdays, selling pre-owned shoes at a popular market. With this loan she would like to increase her sales volume by buying large packs of shoes. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, she would like to build apartments off of her house to rent out, and to become a successful entrepreneur in her area.

loans.use: increase her sales volume by buying large packs of shoes

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias exitosas, es coordinado por la señora Lilliam de 36 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos se dedica a la comercialización de verduras en uno de los mercados capitalinos desde hace seis años, este negocio lo impulso con ayuda de su esposo y solicita el crédito para la compra de quintal de papas, zanahoria, quequisque, yuca, uno de los logros obtenido con los créditos anteriores por la socia es la un anexo que le realizo a su vivienda. Las otras socias son las señoras Silvia de 46 años de edad, comerciante de tamal, pinol y pinolillo desde hace veinticuatro años y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de quintal de maíz, clavo de olor, hojas de chagüite, etc., y Teresa de 63 años de edad, quien elabora y vende cosa de horno desde hace treinta años en su comunidad y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de quintal de maíz, azúcar, queso, leche, etc.
texts.en:
This Solidarity Group is made up of three successful members. It is coordinated by Lilliam, who is 36 years old, she is married and the mother of two children. She’s been selling vegetables for 6 years in one of the markets in the capital. She opened this business with the help of her husband, and she is requesting the loan to buy a quintal of potatoes, carrots, malanga, and cassava. With the previous loan she added a room to her home.

 The other members are Silvia, who is 46 years old, she’s been selling tamale and pinole for the last 24 years. She’ll use this loan to buy a quintal of corn, cloves, banana leaves, etc. And Teresa, who is 63 years old, she’s been making and selling baked goods for thirty years in her community. She’ll use the loan to buy a quintal of corn, sugar, cheese, milk, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel remembers not being able to pay school fees  for his three children during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Daniel, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Daniel  is ambitious and is aiming to reap yields higher than both the national and Babban Gona averages. “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Daniel. With this loan, Daniel is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a Babban Gona farmer from Barau. Markus expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Markus to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Markus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Markus, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 60 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Markus will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home.” With this loan, Markus will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Meripa

texts.en: Meripa is 36 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cucumbers, beans and more in her community. She has been doing this for more than two years. Meripa has requested a loan to buy seeds, chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer and a wheelbarrow. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Meripa hopes to improve the development of her family due to her increased business income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knivies, a weed sprayer and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 56 anos de idade é casada oficialmente mãe de 4 filhos maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelo seu neto que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha no Hotel Xissaka, a mais de 8 anos auferindo um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa e na sua obra. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir material de constrição como: cimento, areia e varões para dar continuidade da sua obra. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra e mobilar a casa para dar mais conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Marta was born in Namaacha, in the Maputo province of Mozambique. She is 56 years old and is married with four grown children, all of whom are in school. She also cares for a grandson who lives with her. 

Marta has worked at the Xissaka Hotel for more than 8 years, earning money that she uses to cover household expenses and also for a home construction project. With this loan she would like to continue with this project by buying sand, cement, and posts. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, she would like to finish the construction and furnish her house so that her family can live comfortably.

loans.use: continue with a construction project by buying sand, cement, and posts.

loans.name: Elise

texts.en: Elise is a 62-year-old woman who is married with five children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has four years of experience in this type of business. Elise has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, scissors, thread and needles. She plans to use her profits to build a sewing shop. She joined SPBD in 2000 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, scissors, thread and needles.

loans.name: Alh. Musa

texts.en: Alh. Musa is a Babban Gona farmer from Baguiwa. Alh. Musa expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Alh. Musa to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Alh. Musa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alh. Musa is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least a total of 70 bags on his 1.3 ha field. By doing so, Alh. Musa will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family.” With this loan, Alh. Musa will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en: Abdullahi is a Babban Gona farmer from Waziri. Abdullahi expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Abdullahi to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abdullahi can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Abdullahi, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 70 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Abdullahi will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family.” With this loan, Abdullahi will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 62 años, se dedica a la cría de todo tipo de animales, como vacas, gallinas, chanchos, etc., está en pareja con la Sra. Ramona, son una pareja muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que esta luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Marcos pide este préstamo para poder comprar dos vaquillas, y de esa forma tener un mayor numero de animales que poder criar. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Marcos is 62 years old and works breeding all types of animals, such as cows, chickens, pigs, etc. He has a partner named Ramona. They are a hardworking and entrepreneurial couple that is working to improve its living conditions and those of its family. 

Marcos is requesting this loan to be able to buy two heifers, which will provide him with a larger number of animals to breed. He thanks the lenders for the opportunity that he is receiving, which will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Miquelina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em chokwe província de gaza tem 44 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 7 filhos, 4 maiores de idade não responsabiliza-se por mais ninguém.
Trabalha na sociedade de águas como servente a mais de 8 anos aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na obra. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir geleira e um jogo de sofás para sua casa. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra e mais tarde adquirir uma viatura para sua família e iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos
texts.en:
Miquelina was born in Chokwe, in the Gaza province of Mozambique. She is 44 years old and lives with her husband. She has seven children, four of whom are grown, and she doesn't provide for anyone else besides her family. 

For more than eight years she's worked as an attendant at a mineral water company, earning money that she uses to cover household expenses and also for a home construction project. With this loan she would like to buy a refrigerator and a set of sofas for her house. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, Miquelina would like to finish the construction project, buy a car for her family, and start a business raising chickens.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator and a set of sofas for her house.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Zavala Província de Inhambane tem 39 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 5 filhos, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus sobrinhos e neto que vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha no Governo a mais de 8 anos auferindo um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. É proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial, Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria adquirindo produtos da 1ª necessidade como açúcar, Arroz, Farinha de milho e muito mais. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende construir dependências para aluguer e adquirir uma viatura para transportar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Adriano was born in Zavala, in the Inhambane province of Mozambique. He is 39 years old and is married with 5 children, all of whom are in school. He also helps care for his nieces and nephews and a grandson, all of whom live in his house.

Adriano has worked for the government for more than eight years, earning money that he uses to cover household expenses. He also owns a store. With this loan he would like to increase his volume of merchandise by buying everyday necessities like sugar, rice, corn meal and other goods. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, he would like to build apartments to rent out and to buy a vehicle with which to transport his goods.

loans.use: increase his volume of merchandise by buying everyday necessities like sugar, rice, corn meal and other goods.

loans.name: João

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 3 filhos menores de idade dos quais 2 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha no Distrito como agente de serviço, também é mestre-de-obras, ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa, com o empréstimo solicitado pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e varões para dar continuidade da sua obra. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na hluvuku.
 Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência, garantir os estudos aos seus filhos e adquirir uma viatura familiar
texts.en:
João was born in the Namaacha province of Maputo. He is 32 years old, is married and is the father of 3 children who are minors, two of whom go to school. He is not responsible for anyone. 

He works in the district as a service agent and is also a master builder. He earns an income that he uses to pay for household expenses. He intends to acquire construction materials like sand, cement, and rods to continue working on his project. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. 

In the future he hopes to finish the work on his house, ensure the education of his children, and acquire a family vehicle.

loans.use: to acquire construction materials like sand, cement, and rods to continue work on his project.

loans.name: Alycia

texts.es: Alycia de 59 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 17 y 20 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida consu pequeño negocio de venta de pupusas el cual realiza en su domicilio, su esposo y sus hijos aportan a la economía familiar gracias a sus respectivos trabajos. Alycia desea reparar el techo de la cocina ya que como se observa en la fotografía está bastante dañada por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en: Alycia is 59 years old and lives with her life partner and their two daughters (17 and 20 years old). She is an entrepreneurial woman that makes a living with her small business selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas), which is located at her home. Her husband and children contribute to the family's income through their respective jobs. Alycia wishes to repair her kitchen's roof. As it can be seen in the photograph, it is damaged. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheets, wood and nails to repair her home's kitchen.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood and nails to repair her home's kitchen.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en: Dahiru is a farmer from Bakutaje.  As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Dahiru can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Dahiru is ambitious and is aiming to reap 50 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Dahiru said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Murtala, Amadu,and Sa'idu, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una humilde mujer que gracias a la cafetería que logro emplear en una institución educativa con lo que ha podido mantener a sus dos hijos pues es madre cabeza de hogar luchadora que toma la vida con las manos y la afronta. 

Como toda empresaria en muchos casos se ve limitada por la falta de recursos para mejorar y en el momento está muy afectada por que debe realizar reformas en su cafetería para seguir operando.

Solicita un crédito para reformar su cafetería tener más surtido para los estudiantes y cumplir a cabalidad las normas para continuar operando lo que se convierte en una gran prioridad pues de esto depende no solo ella y su hija si no sus padres que están a su cuidado.
texts.en:
Sandra is a humble woman that has been supporting her two children thanks to the cafeteria that she was able to open at an educational institution. She is a single mother who works hard, takes charge of her life and is not afraid to face challenges. 

As many businesspersons, she often finds herself limited by the lack of resources to improve her business. She is currently troubled as she needs to make some renovations to her cafeteria for it to continue operating. 

She is requesting a loan to renovate her cafeteria, to have a wider selection for the students and to meet the requirements to continue operating her business. This is her main priority, as not only her and her daughter depend on it, but also her parents, who she takes care of.

loans.use: to renovate her business and to buy supplies at a better price.

loans.name: G.s Alto Verde Group

texts.es:
El señor Santos de 54 años de edad es soltero vive con su hermano  en su casa de habitación, en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle  en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde 36  años al negocio de venta de producto  cómo chineros para guardar platos y utensilios de cocina.

Don Santos es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de salir adelante es el líder del grupo solidario alto verde de San Lorenzo, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de madera, clavos, serruchos, etc. para poder seguir elaborando los muebles y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

Don Santos al igual que sus compañeros de grupo espera que esta inversión que realice le genere los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con sus familias.
Don Lorenzo se dedica a la venta de leche desde hace 10 años.
Doña Keidy se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace varios años.
Doña Maydra se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. 


San Lorenzo. Honduras - Julio del 2014
texts.en:
