Santos is 54 years old. He is single and lives with his brother in his residence, in a community in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. He has been selling china cabinets to keep plates and kitchen utensils for 36 years. 

Santos is an enterprising man, he wants to thrive. He is the leader of the San Lorenzo’s Grupo Solidario Alto Verde. He is requesting the loan to buy wood, nails, and hand saws,etc.to be able to keep making furniture and to comply with his client’s requests. Santos, as well as his group members, hopes that with this investment he gets the necessary income to thrive together with his family. 

Don Lorenzo has been selling milk for 10 years. 

Keidy has been selling used clothes for several years. 

Maydra makes and sells tortillas.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, hand saws, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Tierra Santa Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas, este grupo es coordinado por la señora Martha de 34 anos de edad, soltera y madre de tres hijos por quienes ha luchado para poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida, se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, pastas, carne de res, carne de cerdo, pollo, salsa de tomate, salsa inglesas, remolacha, zanahoria, lechuga, etc., este negocio lo impulso hace tres anos y con este crédito la socia podrá ofrecer este servicio con mejor calidad. Las otras socias son las señoras Norma de 21 anos de edad, comerciante de ropa de segunda en el mercado mas populoso de la capital, y Sonia de 20 anos de edad, quien se dedica a la comercialización de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad.
texts.en:
Grupo Solidario is made up of three hard working women. The group is coordinated by Martha, who is 34 years old, she is single and the mother of three children. She has worked hard to be able to offer them a better life.

She sells food at her house. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, pasta, beef, pork, chicken, tomato sauce, English sauces, beets, carrots, lettuce, etc. She started this business 3 years ago. This member wants to be able to offer a better service thanks to this loan. 

The other two members are Norma, who is 21 years old, she sells used clothes in one of the busiest markets of the capital, and Sonia, who is 20 years old, she puts the crops on sale in the local market.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, pasta, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 35 anos de idade, solteiro pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha na Sociedade de Água como operador de máquinas a mais de 5 anos, auferindo um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirindo material de construção como: areia, blocos e cimento para dar inicia a construção da sua residência. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade.
texts.en:
David was born in Namaacha, in the Maputo province of Mozambique. He is 35 years old and is a single father to two young children. He also helps care for his mother, who lives with him.

David has worked for more than five years as a machine operator at a mineral water company, earning money that he uses to cover household expenses. With this loan he would like to begin a home construction project by buying materials like blocks, sand and cement. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, he would like to start a business selling everyday necessities.

loans.use: begin a home construction project by buying materials like blocks, sand and cement.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chibuto Província de Gaza tem 34 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 2 sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha como promotor de vendas a mais de 5 anos, auferindo um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com o empréstimo solicitado pretende abrir um estabelecimento comercial para a venda de seguintes artigos: saias, calças, vestidos e blusas. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Jose was born in Chibuto, in the Gaza province of Mozambique. He is 34 years old and is married with 3 young children, all of whom are in school. He also helps care for two nephews who live with him.

Jose has worked as a sales promoter for more than five years, earning money that he uses to cover household expenses. With this loan he would like to open a clothing store selling skirts, pants, dresses and shirts. This is his third loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

In the future, he would like to finish a home construction project and make sure that his children are able to finish school..

loans.use: open a clothing store selling skirts, pants, dresses and shirts.

loans.name: El Mango Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socios exitosos en su vida laboral y es coordinado por la señora Karla de 30 años de edad y acompañada, se dedica a comercializar ropa de segunda desde hace cinco años en su comunidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pacas de calidad de camisas, short, jean y vestidos. Otra de las socias es la señora María Candelaria de 28 años de edad, comerciante de frutas en el mercado de Granada y Nandaime desde hace dos años, la señora María Teresa de 45 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de pan, y ha impulsado en negocio de costura en su domicilio desde hace dos años, y el señor Jorge Luis de 38 años de edad comerciante de frutas tanto en la municipalidad como en la capital.
texts.en:
This is a united group comprising four members who are successful in their working lives. It is coordinated by Carla, age 30, who lives with her partner. She has been selling second-hand clothing in her community for 5 years, and she is requesting the loan in order to purchase quality bundles of shirts, shorts, jeans, and dresses. 

Another member is María Candelaria, age 28.  She has been selling fruit in the markets in Granada and Nandaime for two years.  María Teresa, age 45, sells bread, and has boosted the sewing business that she has had in her home for two years.  Jorge Luis, age 38, sells fruit in the municipality as well as in the capital.

loans.use: to purchase quality bundles of shirts, shorts, jeans, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Kathy

texts.es:
Kathy es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es una persona emprendedora, luchadora y muy trabajadora, la buena suerte en los negocios la ha llevado a desarrollar con éxito la administración de un restaurante propio, donde cocina variedad de comidas típicas del lugar como; el majadito(yuca molida), locro de gallina, zonzos de pacumuto (masa de maíz cocinado a la parrilla), etc., todo acompañado de refrescos naturales y típicos como; chicha, somó, achachairú, etc. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona donde vive ‘plan 3000’ situado a doce kilómetros al sur de la ciudad de santa cruz.
Kathy es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su rutina es la misma que viene llevando de lunes a domingo desde hace un año; por la mañana prepara los alimentos para la comida de media mañana como; cuñapes (empanada con queso) con café, a medio día están listos las comidas típicas, los mismos que vuelve a servir por la tarde, su hijo mayor la ayuda en la cocina y sus hijos menores asisten a la escuela primaria. Su experiencia en el negocio la ha llevado a soñar en abrir un restaurante más grande, para poder cumplir con la necesidades de sus hijos. Su barrio es el más poblado de su ciudad y se ha convertido en un lugar de producción donde microempresarios de todas las áreas se han dedicado al comercio para la venta en los principales mercados locales.
Es por esos motivos que Kathy solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su restaurante y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Kathy is a 34-year-old woman living with her partner and her three children. She has a business selling food. She is a entrepreneurial woman, a fighter and a hard worker. She has had good luck with her businesses which has allowed her to successfully develop the management of her own restaurant where she cooks several typical foods from the area such as majadito (ground yucca), chicken stew, zonzos de pacumuto (grilled corn bread), etc. This all comes with natural soft drinks that are typical such as chicha, somó, achachairú, etc. She runs her business in the ´plan 3000´ area situated twelve kilometers to the south of the city of Santa Cruz.

Kathy has a dark complexion, long black hair and is medium height. Her routine is the same Monday through Sunday as it was a year ago. In the morning she prepares the ingredients for the food for the mid-morning meal: cuñapes (cheese empanadas) with coffee. By mid-day the typical foods are ready, which she serves in the afternoon. Her oldest son helps her in the kitchen and her younger children attend primary school. 

Her business experience has led her to dream of opening a bigger restaurant to be able to meet her children´s needs. Her neighborhood is the most populated in the city and it has become a place where small business owners from all over have come to work and sell in the main local markets.

It´s because of all of this that Kathy is asking for a loan to expand her restaurant in order to pay her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant in order to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Bhagyalaxmi Group

texts.en:
Puspanjali is a married woman living with her husband and two children in Unit-6, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. The member standing first on the left with a raised hand is Puspanjali. She, along with her husband, is doing a grocery business in their locality and maintains their livelihood. Their monthly income is near about Rs. 13,000 per month, which was not sufficient to meet their monthly household expenses. 

One of her daughters, named Sradhanjali, is continuing her graduation in science in O.U.A.T. Bhubaneswar. She is a good student and wants to do a B. Tech., but due to lack of money she is not in a position to continue her study. For continuation of her study, Puspanjali wants a loan of Rs. 30,000. Your help will enable Sradhanjali to complete her B. Tech and get a technical job at a handsome salary. 

The other three members of her group are Mamata, Jamuna and Bhagyalaxmi.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Group

texts.en:
Rinalata is a married woman living with her husband and three children in a rental at Bhubaneswar town, Odisha, India. The member standing first on the left with a raised hand is Rinalata. She, along with her husband, is doing a grocery business in their locality and maintains their livelihood. Their monthly income is near about Rs. 13,000 per month, which was not sufficient to meet their monthly household expenses. 

One of her sons, named Anip, is continuing his ITI (Mechanic Trade) in Gop College, Puri. He is a good student and wants to do a diploma in Mechanics, but due to lack of money he is not in a position to continue his study. For continuation of his study, Rinalata wants a loan of Rs. 30,000. Your help will enable Anip to complete his diploma in Mechanical Trade and get a technical job at a handsome salary. 

The other five members of her group are Pramila, Meena, Sanjukta, Santilata and Jayanti.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Pila

texts.en: Pila is 29 years old, single, and the mother of one child. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages and other items in her community and has been doing this for the last three years. Pila has requested a loan to buy seeds, a weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals and other farm supplies. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pila plans to expand her garden so she can earn more income to use to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knivies, a weed sprayer, chemicals and other items.

loans.name: Tumua

texts.en: Tumua is 31 years old, single, and the mother of four children. She has a small plantation where she grows cabbage, tomatoes, beans, and other items to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Tumua has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a weed sprayer, rakes, bush knives, and other supplies. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Tumua hopes to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables seeds, fertilizer, bush knives, a weed sprayer, rakes, and other items.

loans.name: Ricardo Arnulfo

texts.es: Ricardo de 62 años de edad vive con su hija de 37 años de edad y 3 nietos de 13, 10 y 8 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace 40 años se gana la vida como albañil, además en temporada siembra y cultiva; maíz, frijol y maicillo, su hija aporta a la economía familiar dedicándose a la venta de papas fritas. Ricardo desea mejorar su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar pinturas y pagar mano de obra para pintar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 62 years old, and he lives with his daughter, age 37, and 3 grandchildren, ages 13, 10, and 8.  He is an industrious man who has earned his living as a bricklayer for 40 years. Additionally, he cultivates corn, beans, and sorghum during the planting season. His daughter contributes to the family’s finances by selling fried potatoes. 

Ricardo wants to improve his home, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase paint, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to purchase paint and pay for labor in order to paint his house.

loans.name: Hayo's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né le 07 Mai 2009 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois, ces femmes ont pu acquérir une expérience solide dans le programme après 10 cycles soit environ 05 années de vie commune. Les membres du groupe habitent dans le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel. Elles sont très actives dans le commerce et pratique  la culture vivrière sous pluie.

Madame Haya (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans et mariée, mère de 04 enfants. Elle  s’active de la vente de production de pâte d’arachide une activité à fort rentabilité dans la zone. Pour se faire elle achète les graines d’arachide non décortiquées par sac de 50 Kg le plus souvent au marché hebdomadaire international de la sous région, pour ensuite mené son activité de transformation qu’elle maîtrise à merveille. 

Son nouveau prêt, elle compte s’approvisionner par sac de 50 Kg de graines non décortiquée en vu d’obtenir une production de 10 seaux de 20 Kg pour une étape.

Les retombées lui permettront d’une part à développer sa capacité d’autofinancement en renforçant son épargne et d’autre part à mieux participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
[Hayo's] Group was founded May 7, 2009 with the opening of the banc villageois. These women have been able to gain substantial experience in the program after 10 [loan] cycles, or about five years of life together. The group members live in the same village and are motivated by a sense of mutual assistance and support. They are very active in trade and grow food crops during the rainy season.

Mrs. Hayo ([standing] at right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is 28 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She sells groundnut paste, a very profitable business in the area. To do this, she purchases unshelled nuts in sacks of 50kg, usually at the weekly international market in the sub-region, then conducts her business turning [them into paste], which she does beautifully.

With her new loan, Mrs. Haya plans to purchase unshelled nuts by the 50kg sack with the goal of producing 10 buckets of 20kg [each] for the [next] step. The profits will allow her to improve her cash flow while increasing her savings on one hand, while on the other allowing her to better contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase unshelled nuts by the 50kg sack in order to produce 10 buckets of 20kg [each] for the [next] step.

loans.name: Pulemalie

texts.en: Pulemalie is 37 years old, married and the mother of five children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage and other items to people in her community and has been doing this for more than two years. Pulemalie has requested a loan to buy supplies, including seeds, chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow and more. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pulemalie will save for unexpected emergencies and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, a weed sprayer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and other items.

loans.name: Moana

texts.en: Moana is 76 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells handicrafts in her community to earn an income, and has nine years of experience in this business. Moana has requested a loan to buy bags of coconut shells, a new carving tool set, sandpaper, a can of varnish and paint brushes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to its financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of coconut shells, a new carving tool set, sandpaper, a can of varnish and paint brushes.

loans.name: Faalaulaueotausala

texts.en: Faalaulaueotausala is 26 years old, single and the mother of one child. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, boxes of chicken and other items. She joined SPBD earlier this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faalaulaueotausala hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, and boxes of chicken.

loans.name: Alba Onoria

texts.es: Alba es una señora de nacionalidad colombiana, ella vive 6 años en Ecuador juntamente con su esposo y su hijo de 15 años que se encuentra asistiendo al colegio, Alba se dedica a la crianza de animales y al jornal, ella comenta que se vino de su lugar natal hacia Ecuador en busca de trabajo con un pago justo y que si lo encontró, su esposo trabaja con un señor en la agricultura y este señor les presta una casita para que vivan y críen sus animales, Alba necesita el crédito para adquirir chanchos y seguir trabajando en este negocio, Alba aspira en algún momento tener una casita propia para quedarse viviendo en Ecuador.
texts.en: Alba is a woman of Colombian nationality. She lives in Ecuador with her husband and 15-year-old son, who attends school. Alba raises animals and does day work. She comments that she came to Ecuador from her birthplace in search of work with a fair pay and that she found it. Her husband works with a man in agriculture, and this man lends them a little house so that they can live and raise their animals. Alba needs the loan to acquire pigs and continue working in this business. Alba hopes at some time to have her own little house to continue living in Ecuador.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Shri Ganesh Group

texts.en:
Kunti is a married woman of 36 years, and is the mother of three daughters. She is a permanent resident of the village of Gadramunda in Nuapada district of Odisha, India. She is sitting in the middle with a raised hand in the photo.  

Kunti has a vegetable growing farm, which she manages with her husband. She grows vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, ladies finger (okra), etc. on her farm located in the same village. She sells her products at wholesale to the traders of the nearby market as well as at retail by going to villages. Apart from this, she also has a dairy farm of five cows. She supplies milk to the tea stalls of a nearby town. 

She earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR from the above two income sources. But this income is not sufficient for her to manage the family expenses along with the vegetable farm and dairy farm expenses. So, to earn some extra income for smooth maintenance of the above, Kunti, along with twelve other women of her village, formed a Self-Help Group (SHG) named Shri Ganesh to avail a loan of 16,000 INR from Mahashakti Foundation. 

She will utilize a part of the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs such as seeds and pesticides, and the rest of the amount for purchasing another milking cow. She hopes that this investment will help her to gain additional income to fulfill her dream of giving higher education to her daughters.

Another seven members of the SHG are doing vegetable cultivation with vending, three are selling milk, one member is running a general store and one member is running an auto repair shop.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and another milking cow to gain additional income to fulfill her dream of giving higher education to her daughters.

loans.name: Chayna

texts.en:
Chayna is a rural woman of 28 years. She hails from Maynaguri. She is married, a housewife, and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). She is very young, energetic, hardworking and optimistic. Her husband, Latiful, aged 33 years, does cultivation on their own land. They live in Bagnan, a remote village in the district of Jalpaiguri. Chayna studied until grade 9, and did not get the opportunity to study further due to their parents' poverty. Her husband has a primary education. Two of her children attend school; one is too young for school.

Chayna's husband has always worked in agriculture. He is the only earning member for the family and always strives for the betterment of his family. Chayna, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. They mainly cultivate seasonal vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. But it is difficult for them to run a family of five members in a decent way with such a small income. They thought to expand their business and start cultivation of jute, which is a profitable crop, but they cannot fulfill their dream due to lack of capital.

So, Chayna has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase jute seeds and other necessary things related to cultivation. She hopes it will be a lucrative business and will provide them with much profit to give her family financial stability. 

She dreams of making improvements in their business and giving higher education to her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Pamata

texts.en:
Pamata is a 58-year-old woman who is married with seven children. 

She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Pamata has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material. She plans to use her profits to provide for her family's weekly essential needs and help with the renovation of her house. 

She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material

loans.name: Sauimalae

texts.en:
Sauimmalae is a 26-year-old woman with two children. 

She runs a small elei (fabric printing) business selling to the members of her community and to the public in town. She has been a member of the SPBD program for 3years and is continuing to do well at making money out of her business.

She plans to use this loan to purchase fabric materials, fabric paints, brushes, and rollers for elei printing business. Sauimalae has managed to improve the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials, fabric paints, brushes, and rollers

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa se caracteriza por ser una señora muy alegre, ella es colombiana y reside 5 años en Ecuador, Teresa es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 8 y 13 años mismos que están estudiando, Teresa trabaja al jornal y también cría animales menores, con este crédito va a comprar y comercializar cuyes, Teresa trabaja muy duro para darles a sus hijos lo más indispensable y aspira en algún momento ver a sus hijos culminado sus estudios.
texts.en:
Teresa is characterized by being a very happy person.  She is Colombian and has lived for five years in Ecuador.  Teresa is a single mother, she has three children, ages 5, 8 and 13, all of whom are in school.

Teresa is a day worker and also raises small animals.  With this loan, she will buy guinea pigs and sell them.  Teresa works very hard to give her children the important things in life and aspires to some day see her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek is 68 years old and a married woman who has three dependent children and three married children. She lives in the Bakan District of Pursat Province, which is located in the western part of the Cambodia. 

To earn a living, she and her husband manage a rice farming business which is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for nearly forty years with the average income is $6 a day. 

Sek wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing money through Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. 

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Iaeli

texts.en:
Iaeli is a 48-year-old married woman with six children. 

She owns and operates a store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 12 years. 

Iaeli needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions, potatoes, a bag of sugar, rice and salt. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2002 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions, potatoes, a bag of sugar, rice, and salt

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Lusia is a 31-year-old partnered woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation and grows up cabbages, cucumbers, peas, pumpkins, etc., to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Lusia has requested a loan to buy a spade, a rake, fertilizers, bush knives, seeds, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, she will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a spade, a rake, fertilizers, seeds, chemicals, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Manufou

texts.en:
Manufou is 57 years old and a married woman with five children. 

She runs a small business selling sandwiches, noodles, etc., in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Manufou has requested a loan to buy boxes of noodles, tinned fish, bread, eggs, mayonnaise, food wraps, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Manufou will save it for unexpected emergencies and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy boxes of noodles, breads, tinned fish, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Taimane

texts.en: Taimane is a 50-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small fishing business assisted by her husband and two workers who they hire. She sells her fish not only in front of the road at their village but they also bring them to the fish market. She also has a plantation which she sells her crops at the market earning them extra income. She has been with the SPBD program for more than three years and has found it quite helpful to her. She plans to use this loan to purchase five fishing nets, fishing strings, tools for fishing net, fishing boots, a fishing canoe and a cooler for her fishing business. Taimane has managed to make improvements on her family's living standards and hopes to continue to do so from the profits she is saving from her business.

loans.use: to purchase five fishing nets, fishing strings, tools for fishing net, fishing boots, a fishing canoe and a cooler.

loans.name: Taase

texts.en: Taase is a 32-year-old woman with three children. She operates a taxi business driven by her partner of more than eight years. She also runs a small canteen business catering for the school children, and sells fish from her husband's fishing at times that he takes a break from their taxi. She has decided to join the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance so that she would be able to be more successful in the different businesses she is running with her partner. With this money, she would purchase new tyres and seat covers for her taxi business. She plans to save as much as possible from the profits she will make from her business so that she will be able to meet their weekly financial obligations.

loans.use: to purchase new tyres and seat covers.

loans.name: Olova

texts.en:
Olova is a 41-year-old married woman with 7 children. She runs a business selling vegetables  to the members of her community and to the public in the town market. 

She join the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance  to improve  her vegetable business. With this money, she plans to purchase a wheelbarrow, water hose, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, chemicals, rakes, a pitch fork, knives, and blade sharpener. 

She hopes to use her profits to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a wheelbarrow, water hose, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, chemicals, rakes, pitch forks, knives, and blade sharpener.

loans.name: Dinora Mariselda

texts.es: Dinora de 31 años de edad vive con  su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 7, 4 y 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se desempeña prestando sus servicios domésticos, además su esposo aporta a la economía familiar prestando sus servicios  de jornalero. Dinora desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía, este no es muy seguro por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dinora, 31 years old, lives with her husband and her three children: ages 7, 4, and 12.  She is a hard-working woman who holds a position providing housework services.  In addition to this, her husband contributes to the family finances working as a day laborer.  

Dinora wishes to re-roof her home, which is visible in the photograph.  It is not very secure, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy galvanized sheets of metal, wood, and nails to re-roof her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to re-roof her home

loans.name: Autasia

texts.en:
Autasia is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children. She runs a small plantation and canteen business to sell to  her community, school children and to the public at  town market. 

This is the third year  as a  member of the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. With this money, she plans to purchase chemicals, bush knives, and blade sharpeners for her plantation business.  She will purchase containers, flour, cooking oil, sugar, and a cooking stove for her canteen business. 

Autasia hopes to save her profits to  improve and expand her business and meet her family's financial obligations.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, bush knives, blade sharpeners, containers, flour, cooking oil, sugar, and a cooking stove

loans.name: Imoa

texts.en:
Imoa is a 49-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 6 years of experience with this business. 

Imoa has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and rolls of material. She plans to use her profits to pay her families' weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and rolls of material.

loans.name: Bellentina

texts.en: Bellentina is a 30-year-old woman with three children. She runs a small plantation business assisted by her partner of two years and sells the produce to the members of her community and also to the members of the public at the market in town. This is the second year she has joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. With this loan she plans to purchase chemicals, bush knives, a blade sharpener, wheelbarrow, taro roots, banana roots, taamu roots for her plantation business and pay school fees for her kids' education. Bellentina plans to expand her plantation business through saving a lot of profit from her business and at the same time meeting their weekly financial obligations.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, a blade sharpener, wheelbarrow, taro roots, banana roots, taamu roots and school fees.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is a 48-year-old married woman who has two married children and one depended child. She lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province. 

She and her husband manage a rice farm which is the sole source of their income. They have been in this occupation for almost thirty years earning an average income of 5 USD a day. 

Sokhom wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house. Therefore, she is borrowing from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Yay

texts.en:
Yay is a 62-year-old married woman with one married daughter. She lives in Somrong Tong District of Kampong Speu Province. 

In the last forty years, she and her husband have grown rice and sell to the local dealers. It is the sole source of their income. Her family’s daily income is 5 USD.

Yay wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house. She requests a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Manaen

texts.es: Manaen de 50 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 22, 20, 17 y 13 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como albañil por contrato, además en temporada cultiva y cosecha maíz y maicillo para tener un ingreso extra. Manaen desea construir una pared en su vivienda, además desea encementar el piso por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: arena, grava, cemento, bloque de concreto y hierro para construir una pared  y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Manaen, age 50, lives with his wife and his 4 children, ages 22, 20, 17, and 13.  He is a hardworking man, who earns a living as a contract bricklayer, and he also cultivates and harvests corn and sorghum in order to have an extra income. 

Manaen wants to build a wall in his home and install a concrete floor, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase sand, gravel, cement, concrete block, and iron.

loans.use: to purchase sand, gravel, cement, concrete block, and iron, in order to build a wall and install a concrete floor in his home.

loans.name: Chirel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Chirel works hard to support her family.

She has a general store  in the Philippines and  earns additional income from food vending and e-loading (mobile prepaid load). Chirel is borrowing  10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase  groceries to sell in her general store.

Chirel has sustained her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF and  Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amaketo

texts.en:
Amaketo is 27 years old and she is a mother of two. She runs a small business, selling pancakes in her community and she has been doing this for three years. 

Amaketo has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, vegetable oil, baking powder, and an oven. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in June 2014 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Amaketo will save more for her children's education and to financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, vegetable oil, baking powder, and an oven.

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Samoeun is a 41-year-old married woman who has two married children and one depended child. She lives in Samrong Tong District of Kampong Speu Province. 

She and her husband manage a rice farming business which is the sole source of their income. They have been in this occupation for almost twenty years and earn an average income of 6 USD a day. 

Samoeun wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house. Therefore, she requests a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a food business in the Philippines and earns additional income from operating a general store, dressmaking, and renting houses.  Delia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Delia has sustained her business activities through two previous loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ma. Ninfa Desirre

texts.en:
Ma. Ninfa Desirre works hard to support her family. She is single and has a natural medicine agri-trading business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for three years.

Ma. Ninfa Desirre requested 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy new refrigerator and oven. 

In the future, Ma. Ninfa Desirre would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and oven to store her food and medicines.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a 48-year-old married woman who works very hard to provide for her family.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  Elma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Taumaia

texts.en:
Taumaia is 50 years old and married, with five children. She has a large plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells at the market. She's also running a small cattle farm business. She has been doing this for eight years. 

Taumaia needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and crops. For her cattle farm, she'll also be buying barbed wire and overalls for the workers. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2006. Taumaia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, crops, barbed wire, and overalls for the workers.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de quesos ,la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua elaborando los quesos para de esta manera distribuirlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This partner continues making a living in the business of selling cheese.  She has for years made a living in this business, which goes well for her thanks to the determination that she applies to it every day.  She continues making cheeses to distribute to her clients, as they request.  

She desires to be able to continue working so that she may continue supporting her family.  She requests the loan to buy milk among other things.  She is happy with the loan previously granted and is committed to comply with the payment of the installments on the loan.

loans.use: to buy milk among other things

loans.name: Madella

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Madella works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vegetables-vending. Madella is borrowing PHP 5,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more items like sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, a 51-year-old married woman, is a hardworking rice farmer in Svay Antor district, Prey Veng province. Ny has five children; three of them are married and two are in school. Through the efforts of Ny and her husband, they are able to make an income of 8.00 USD a day each. 

Ny wants to obtain household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a home solar energy system. Due to inadequate funds, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, Ny hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. Ny is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a home solar energy system

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Gemma has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Bana

texts.en:
Bana, a 31-year-old housewife, lives with her two sons and husband Sulal, 38 years old, in the small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their small kachha house (a house made of mud, bamboo and straw). Bana and her husband both are illiterate and can sign their names only. The poor economic resources of their parents did not provide them with elementary education. Their sons are getting education and are in grade 9 and grade 7 respectively.

Bana's husband is a farmer. He has been farming on their small land for many years and supplements their family's income. But the current business does not provide them with enough money to meet their family's needs. Financially, she wants to give support to her husband and family. She wants to start her own business, cultivating paddy on their land and selling the produce in the local market. She has given preference to this business, since paddy cultivation is a very profitable business in their area. 

So, she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS. She is going to use her loan to buy good-quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland to cultivate paddy and get a plentiful harvest. She hopes that the business will provide sufficient support to run her family well and give a secure future to her family.

Her desire for the future is to be able to provide higher education to her sons so that they can be established in life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 25 years old and married, with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Telesia needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a crowbar, rakes, a machete, chemicals, a spade and new gumboots. She just became a member of SPBD this year. Telesia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a crowbar, rakes, a machete, chemicals, a spade and new gumboots

loans.name: Arivjikh

texts.en:
Mr. Arivjikh, 57 years old, lives with his two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been offering taxi service to local people since 2004. His elder son studied at a Korean college and now works at a mining company. The younger one goes to university and will graduate next year. Arivjikh's wife has passed away and it is up to him to take responsibility for their two sons. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to run a car wash facility so that he can generate more income for his family and help his sons' lives. He thinks this car wash business can be a family business as his sons are willing to support him.

loans.use: to run a car wash facility

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia Yanet continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de lácteos como leche y quesos, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la ganaderia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Credit group member Yanet continues to work selling dairy products such as milk and cheese. She has been engaged in this business for quite some time and it is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day, and she also continues raising livestock.

The member wants to be able to continue working so that in this way, she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of milk, along with other products. She is happy to have the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase milk, along with other products.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 44 years old and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns income from food vending.

Florenda has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like bread, candies, and shampoo to sell. She has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like bread, candies, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. Mary Jane earns additional income from herbal medicine.

She is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 55 years old and a widowed woman, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nenita has a food business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nenita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maa Mangala-B Group

texts.en:
In the year 2014, eleven women from the village of Duajhar of Nuapada district of Odisha, India united together and formed a Self-Help Group named Maa Mangala-B to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the further development of their existing businesses. All of them hail from a poor background. Sarojini is one of them and is standing with a raised hand in the photo. She is 48 years old and residing with her husband and a son of 25 years. 

Sarojini has a vegetable cultivation farm in her village with a traditional water-lifting system from the dug well. She and her husband look after the farm. They produce vegetables such as brinjal, cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumber, papaya, ladies finger (okra), popcorn, etc. on the farm. Traders come to her farm for taking the produce. 

Sarojini says the traditional water-lifting system consumes more time, energy and manpower, so she incurred some losses due to this. She earns a monthly income of 4,000 INR from the above businesses. For future development of her family, Sarojini wants to expand her business by taking a fresh loan. With this loan, she has planned to buy fertilizer and farm inputs such as seeds and pesticides for her farm and purchase a diesel water pump for lifting water. By this, she can save the time and manpower and can utilize the same in other farm work. She expects a good return from this investment. 

Sarojini dreams to construct a house and of the marriage of her son. 

The other members of this group are involved in businesses such as vegetable cultivation and vending, Castro oil selling, and puffed rice selling.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticides for her farm and purchase a diesel water pump for lifting water.

loans.name: El Buen Sembrador - Cruz B1 Group

texts.es: Santos Miguel tiene 51 años de edad, (aparece en la foto en la posición cuarto , de izquierda a derecha, viste sombrero, camisa de rayas de color celeste), vive en el municipio de Santa Lucía Utatlán, departamento de Sololá, solicita nuevamente crédito porque el anterior le dejo muchos beneficios y aseguró la alimentación de su familia este año, y lo que no van a consumir lo sacará al mercado para obtener un ingreso más, el maíz es la base de la alimentación de la familias por lo tanto tiene mucha demanda, antes de tener crédito Santos Miguel no podía tener metas porque todo su capital lo invertían en el mantenimiento de maíz, Santos Miguel necesita nuevamente crédito para comprar insumos (abono químico)  para el mantenimiento de maíz, al obtener un compromiso por medio del crédito Santos Miguel se fue haciéndose más responsable, y también le ayuda a obtener una buena cosecha, Santos Miguel tiene como meta construir dos cuatros más para su familia, y así poder vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Santos Miguel, 51, (he appears in the photo fourth from the left wearing a hat and a shirt with blue stripes) lives in the municipality of Santa Lucia Utatlán, Sololá Department.  He is again requesting a loan because the previous one brought him much benefit and assured food for his family this year.  What they will not consume, he will take to market for some additional income since corn is the basis of food for families so there is much demand.  Before having a loan, Santos Miguel could not have goals because all of his capital was invested in maintaining corn.  Santos Miguel needs a loan again to buy supplies (chemical fertilizer) for the maintenance of corn.  By obtaining a commitment through the loan, Santos Miguel became more responsible and it enabled him to obtain a better crop.  Santo Miguel has a goal to construct two more rooms for his family and thus live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of corn.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose a la ganaderia,el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio a la vez continua trabajando como albañil en las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para arreglar su establo.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victor continues to make a living raising livestock. He has been working in this field for many years now and his business has gone well for him thanks to the determination he brings to his work every day. Victor is also still working in construction for the projects that request his services. 

Victor hopes to be able to continue working this way to support his family. He is requesting a loan to fix his stable. Victor is happy to have this loan and pledges to make the repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: to fix his stable.

loans.name: Herdiresa

texts.en:
Herdiresa is 38 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Herdiresa has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria Leonisa

texts.es: María  tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera  y tiene un hijo de 9 años y una hija de 19 años, ella trabaja en una cafetería y en sus tiempos libres  al igual que los fines de semana se dedica al comercio de ropa, los hijos de María se encuentran estudiando, ella necesita el crédito para comprar mercadería en ropa  y aspira variar sus productos para incrementar su negocio y seguir educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old. She's a single mother and has a 9-year-old daughter and a 19-year-old daughter. 

She works in a cafeteria, and in her free time and her weekends she dedicates herself to selling clothes. María's children can be found studying.

She needs the loan to buy clothing merchandise. She aspires to vary her products to increase her income and continue educating her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for new employees to help expand his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rose has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Rose requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Rose has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, solicita nuevamente crédito para invertir en el cultivo de papa, anteriormente le era imposible cultivar por que la organizaciones de crédito no apoyan la agricultura, Manuel necesita nuevamente el crédito para comprar insumos (semilla de papa, abono orgánico, abono químico) para el cultivo de papa, al obtener el crédito es seguro que obtiene muy buena cosecha porque va contar con capital para el mantenimiento de su cultivo y con las ventas asegura el pago del crédito, Manuel tiene como meta terminar de construir su vivienda porque le falta puertas y ventanas.
texts.en:
Manuel is 34 years old and lives in the municipality of Sololá, in the department [equivalent of a US state] of Sololá.

He is requesting another loan to invest in growing potatoes. Before, it was impossible for him to farm because the credit organizations don't support agriculture. Manuel needs a loan again to buy supplies (potato seeds and organic & chemical fertilizer) to grow his potatoes.

With this loan, he is sure that he will have a very good harvest because he will be able to use this financing to maintain his crop, and with its sales, he will ensure the loan repayment. 

Manuel's goal is to finish construction on his house because right now it is missing doors and windows.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, cabbage plantlings, and fertilizer

loans.name: Lisseth Del Carmen

texts.es: Lisseth Del Carmen: Es una señora cordial, originaria de Managua, tiene 37 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos, la mayor de 17 años culmino su secundaria, sin embargo debido a problemas económicos no pudo entrar a la universidad este año, la menor de 6 años estudia su primer grado de primaria. Su esposo es albañil. Cuenta con una experiencia de 17 años de ser docente. Desde hace 5 años habita en casa de madera. Con el propósito de mejorar la madera del piso del corredor de su casa, solicita financiamiento para comprar madera y establecer un pequeño negocio de venta de helados y refrescos naturales en su vivienda. Su sueño es mejorar el techo de su vivienda y el terreno, debido a que se inunda con las lluvias.
texts.en:
Lisseth Del Carmen is a friendly woman, originally from Managua. She is 37 years old and married with two children. 

The oldest, who is 17, finished her high school but due to economic problems, could not enter university this year. The youngest, who is 6, is in her first year of primary school. Her husband is a mason.

She has been a teacher for 17 years. For five years, she has lived in a wood house. 

With the goal of improving the floor wood in the corridor of her house, she's seeking financing to buy wood and establish a small business selling ice cream and natural refreshing drinks in her home. Her dream is to improve the ceiling of her house and the land, because it floods with the rains.

loans.use: to improve the floor wood in the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de quesos, manjares y yogures, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo de forma ambulatoria a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Máxima continues her business making and selling cheeses, sweets and yogurts. She has been doing this for year, and business is going well, thanks to the determination with which she works every day.

She continues to make her sales door-to-door, to all the customers who request her business. She wants to continue working in this way, to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase milk, among other things. She is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to complete all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase milk, among other things

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia lleva años de dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para el arreglo de su retablo y alimentos para sus animales.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonarda continues to make a living by raising livestock. She has been working in this business for years and it has gone well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. Leonarda is a responsible and determined woman. She also works in agriculture. Leonardo wishes to continue this work so that she can support her family. 

She is requesting this loan in order to repair her altar and to buy food for her animals. Leonarda is happy for this loan and pledges to make all of her scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to repair her altar and to buy food for her animals.

loans.name: Sofhy

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Sofhy works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Sofhy is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts to sell to customers. Sofhy has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell to customers.

loans.name: Timberely

texts.en:
For eight years, Timberely has shown her clients how to put their mental and physical health first. She has been a licensed massage therapist for fifteen years and the proud owner of her luxury massage service, Just Unwind, located in Austin, Texas, for eight. 

“I have dedicated my entire life to massage therapy. It all began for me as a child—my mother suffered from chronic back pain and would have me rub her back with BenGay®, hoping to alleviate her pain,” Timberely said.
 
Today, she spends her time giving her clients personalized attention and care through Swedish, hot stone, deep tissue and herbal Thai massages. From dealing with chronic pain, athletic pursuits or to simply relax, Timberely encourages her clients to develop their physical health and well-being. 

Timberely reached out to Accion Texas Inc.—a nonprofit, multi-state and small business lender—for support in the purchase of supplies for her massage service, such as body oils, towels, medicated ointments and stones. As her business continues to thrive, Timberely continues to share her passion for massage with her clients. 

 “I started Just Unwind because I am serious about this business, and I care about my clients,” Timberely said. “People don’t realize they don’t have to accept their aches and pains as that is just the way it is. The best part of my job is being able to make people feel better.”

To learn more about Timberely and Just Unwind, visit her website at justunwindmassage.net.

loans.use: to pay for body oils, towels, medicated creams, and stones.

loans.name: El Buen Sembrado - Cruz B2 Group

texts.es: Miguel Angel tiene 29 años de edad, (aparece en la foto de último , de izquierda a derecha, viste playera anaranjada), vive en el municipio de Santa Lucía Utatlán, departamento de Sololá, solicita nuevamente crédito ya que el anterior le dejo muchos beneficios y aseguró la alimentación de su familia para un año, el maíz tiene demanda en la comunidad porque es la base de la alimentación de las familia y lo que le sobre Miguel Angel lo venderá para obtener un ingreso más, anteriormente Miguel Angel prestaba con personas particulares y la tasa de interés que cobran es muy alta y lo dejan sin posibilidades mejorar la vida de su familia, Miguel Angel necesita nuevamente crédito para comprar insumos (abono químico)  para el mantenimiento de maíz, con el crédito es casi seguro que obtiene buena cosecha, la meta de Miguel Angel es construir su propia casa ya que actualmente vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel (farthest to the right, in the orange t-shirt) is 29 years old, and lives in the municipality Santa Lucía Utatlán, in the department of Sololá.

He is requesting another loan, since he greatly benefited from the previous one and was able to feed his family for a year.

Corn is in high demand in his community because it is the families' staple food. What Miguel Angel doesn't need, he sells as another source of income.

Previously, Miguel Angel borrowed from individuals, but the interest rate they charged was very high and left him without the ability to improve his family's situation.

Miguel Angel needs another loan to purchase supplies (fertilizer) for corn cultivation. With the loan, he is nearly certain that he will have a good harvest. His goal is to construct his own house, since he currently lives with his parents.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for corn cultivation

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de leche, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose al negocio de ganaderia,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leocadia continues her work selling milk, which she has done for years. Business is going well, thanks to the determination with which she works every day. She also continues to make a living selling cattle. She wants to be able to continue these businesses, so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase milk, among other things.

She is very grateful for this opportunity, and promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase milk, among other things

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a la ganaderia,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia conti8nua vendiendo leche de sus ganados a sus clientes que le solicitan y en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia dese poder seguir trabajando  para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha continues to make a living by raising livestock. She has worked in this business for many years, and it is going well, thanks to the determination with which she works each day. She is a responsible and enterprising person.

She also continues selling her cows' milk to customers that request it and in the various markets in the area. She wants to be able to continue in this line of work to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow. She is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to make all loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Sarlita

texts.en: Sarlita, 65 years old, is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 30 years, Sarlita has had a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. Sarlita would like to save enough money to expand her business and support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Tania Naduska

texts.es: Tania Naduska: Es una señora alegre, originaria de Rosita, tiene 30 años, casada con dos hijos: La mayor tiene 14 años y cursa su segundo año de secundaria y el menor de 3 años de edad. Su esposo es entrenador de ejercicios. Ella trabaja como cajera. Con el propósito de construir su vivienda de concreto, en el terreno que compro con el aguinaldo y ahorro, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: zinc, clavos, maderas, bloques, cemento, hierro y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones necesarias a su familia.
texts.en:
Tania Naduska is a happy woman native to Rosita. She is 30 years old and married with two children. Her oldest child is 14 years old and is in her second year of high school. Tania Naduska's youngest child is 3 years old. Her husband is a personal trainer and she works as bank teller. 

With the goal of building a house out of concrete, Tania Naduska is requesting this loan to allow her to build on the land that she bought with her bonuses and savings. Tania Naduska will use this loan to buy construction materials: zinc, nails, wood, cinderblocks, cement, iron, and to pay the builders.  Her dream is to have a home that provides adequate conditions for her family.

loans.use: to build a house made of concrete.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a 38-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She has a small stall selling coconuts to members of her community and also to the traveling public. To earn extra income, she also sells Samoan taro and banana chips. Elisapeta needs a loan to buy timber and iron roofing sheets for her stall, and for her chips she'll also be buying cooking oil, salt, plastic bags, seasoning and a deep pot. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Elisapeta joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy timber and iron roofing sheets for her stall, and cooking oil, salt, plastic bags, seasoning and a deep pot to make chips.

loans.name: Zainah

texts.en:
Zainah is a hard working woman. Zainah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Zainah has been working hard to manage her canteen business, which sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Zainah has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy flour to make more snacks, and will help Zainah to generate greater profits and develop the family well being. Zainah hopes that in the future she will be able to return to school. 

Zainah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy flour to make more snacks.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah is a hard working woman. Reginah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Reginah has been working hard to manage her food stall business, where she sells drinks and snacks. 

To help expand her business, Reginah has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items and drinks, and will help Reginah to generate greater profits and educate her child. Reginah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Reginah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more food items and drinks.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking woman. She is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. Grace has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, she has been working hard to manage her business where she sells phone accessories, phones, laptops, and dryers. 

Grace is requesting a 900,000 UGX loan to buy more phones to sell and help expand her business. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and educate her children. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell

loans.name: Hasifah

texts.en:
Hasifah is 38 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has four children; three of them are currently in school. For the past nine years, Hasifah has been working hard to manage her grocery shop, which sells vegetables and fruit. 

To help expand her business, Hasifah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. 

The loan will be used to purchase different types of vegetables and fruit, and will help Hasifah to generate greater profits and meet family needs. Hasifah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch. 

Hasifah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hasifah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase different types of vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells bananas. 

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bananas, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to have higher sales. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hellen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bananas.

loans.name: Kasha

texts.en:
Kasha is 35 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. For the past four years, Kasha has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells men's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Kasha has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. 

The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Kasha to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. 

Kasha hopes that in the future she will be able to have a fully stocked boutique. 

Kasha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kasha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Night has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Night has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods such as sugar and salt for the business. It will also help Night generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Night hopes that in the future she will be able to buy another plot of land. 

Night is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Night who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods such as sugar and salt for her business

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married, and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 20 years, Kasifa has been working hard to manage her electronics shop, which sells electronic items. 

To help expand her business, Kasifa has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. 

The loan will be used to buy more electronic items, and will help Kasifa to generate greater profits. 

She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Kasifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kasifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more electronic items

loans.name: Mary Gorreti

texts.en:
Mary Gorreti is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Mary Gorreti has been working hard to manage her guest house, which operates a bar and guest house.

To help expand her business Mary Gorreti has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build other rooms for the guest house, and will help her to generate greater profits and increase her income. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger hotel.
