Mary Gorreti is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary Gorreti who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.





"

loans.use: to build other rooms for the guest house

loans.name: Badiru

texts.en:
Badiru is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past 13 years, Badiru has been working hard to manage his timber business, which sells beds, timber, sideboards, and chairs. 

To help expand his business, Badiru has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber, and will help Badiru to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Badiru hopes that in the future he will be able to produce quality furniture for his customers. 

Badiru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Badiru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: purchase more timber for his business.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 33 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki, in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past six years, Jonathan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells essential commodities. 

To help expand his business, Jonathan has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods for the business, like sugar and salt, and will help Jonathan to generate greater profits and stock more goods in the shop to sell. Jonathan hopes that, in the future, he will be able to own a big retail shop. 

Jonathan is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Jonathan, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods for the business, like sugar and salt.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 37 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Michael has been working hard to manage his bar where he sells beer, soda, wine and spirits. 

To help expand his business, Michael has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items like sodas, beer, wine and spirits for sale and will help Michael to generate greater profits and take good care of his children so they have a better life. Michael hopes that in the future, he will be able to stock enough drinks in the bar to increase his sales. 

Michael is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Michael who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more items like sodas, beer, wine and spirits to sell

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a hardworking woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Racheal has been working hard to manage her clothing business, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Racheal has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Racheal to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Racheal hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a cow. 

Racheal is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gatrude

texts.en:
Gatrude is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli, in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has eight children, none of whom are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Gatrude has been working hard to manage her restaurant, in which she sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Gatrude has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cooking equipment and will help Gatrude to generate greater profits.Gatrude hopes that, in the future, she will be able to enlarge her restaurant. 

Gatrude is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Gatrude, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cooking equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials such as bricks.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 29 years old and married. She and her husband are blessed with two children aged two and nine years. Veronica runs a school  but also has a secondary business where she sell items on retail in an open air field which earns her a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 100,000, which she will use to buy furniture for the school she runs and move to a shop where she can continue selling her items on retail. She plans to use the profits from the loan to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the school and open a retail shop to run her retail business

loans.name: Jerlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jerlie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling coco lumber. Jerlie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items like sardines, instant noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Jerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like sardines, instant noodles, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Iva

texts.en: Iva is a 46-year-old single woman. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Iva needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, baking powder and an oven. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to support her family. Iva has been a member of SPBD since June this year 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and sugar, vegetable oil, baking powder and an oven.

loans.name: Duffy

texts.en:
Duffy is 34 years old and a married women with three children. 

She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Duffy has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, cooking oil, frying pans, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Duffy will improve and use the profit for her business and her family."

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, cooking oil, frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El socio Ruben se dedica al negocio de venta de productos naturales, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar productos naturales.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Ruben runs a business selling natural products and works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Ruben has had this business for four years, and it's prospering. His ambition is to expand the natural products business, and he is applying for a loan to purchase more inventory. 

Ruben is happy about the loan and committed to making timely and full payments.

loans.use: to purchase natural products.

loans.name: Teresito

texts.en:
In Ozamiz City, a hardworking man is Teresito. He is married with three children and supports his family through farming. He cultivates a hectare of rice field that  he owns. 

To produce healthy and productive crops, he has to maintain the farming supplies and upgrade the plowing system. To assure the maintenance, he asks for financial support from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.  

He borrowed the amount of PHP 25,000.00. This will be a great help for him and the source of his living.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and upgrade the  plowing system

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife operates a motor transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts/repair

loans.name: Rayna

texts.en:
Rayna is 28 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rayna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rayna has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 39 years old and single with children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening and food vending.

Analyn aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Alma has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Alma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila: Es una señora amable y luchadora, tiene 48 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos: 3 mayores de edad y el menor de 14 años que estudia su primer año de secundaria. Su esposo es comerciante Desde hace muchos años ha vivido en una casa de tambo de madera, con 5 personas.  Con el propósito de construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales: Cemento, madera zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano obra. Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de madera y una vivienda segura y digna.
texts.en: Lucila is a kind and hardworking woman. She is 48 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are adults and her youngest son is 14 and in high school. Lucila's husband is a businessman. For many years they have lived in a wooden house with 5 other people. With the goal of building a house with a cement base and wooden walls, Lucila is requesting her second loan to buy materials such as cement, wood, zinc, nails, and to pay builders. Her dream is to have her own business selling wood and to have a safe and dignified home.

loans.use: to build a house with a cement base and wooden walls.

loans.name: Tsedenbal

texts.en:
Mr. Tsedenbal, 28 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2011. He also works part time at a power station as an electric engineer assistant. Tsedenbal's wife is currently unemployed and looks after their one-year-old daughter at home. 

Tsedenbal is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to repair his electric car so that he can continue to run his taxi service without discomfort and thereby increase customer satisfaction. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel compared to other engines. The government is encouraging people to use more electric cars for environmental safety. Tsedenbal is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his beloved wife and daughter.

loans.use: to repair his electric car

loans.name: Bold

texts.en:
Bold is one of our most reliable clients and lives alone in the capital city of Mongolia. 

He renders taxi service to local people as well as working part time as sentry at high school. 

Recently Bold decided to open a cafeteria together with his brother. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 1,900,000 MNT to rent a place for the cafeteria, buy foodstuffs, and hire a cook. 

If this business succeeds, his living standard will surely improve.

loans.use: to open a cafeteria

loans.name: Mary Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Mary Carmen  se dedica al negocio de venta de productos alimenticios, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos alimenticios. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos alimenticios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Mary Carmen works in her business selling food products. She works from 8 am until 8 pm. She has run this business for 7 years and things are gong well for her. Her dream is to expand her business selling food. Mary Carmen is requesting the loan to buy food products. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is taking a course in Hotel and Restaurant Services. She chose this course because she thinks that it will be her stepping stone to help her parents and siblings. Diana wants to take out a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders to pay her tuition fees. Diana believes that, through education, she can achieve all of her dreams in life and have a profitable job later on.

loans.use: To pay for her tution fees

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen: Es originaria de Rosita, tiene 32 años de edad, madre soltera de un pequeño de 8 meses. Desde hace mucho tiempo vive en una casa de tambo de madera, habitada por 6 personas. Con el propósito de cambiar la madera de vivienda solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales: madera zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: María del Carmen is a native of Rosita She is 32 years old, the single mother of an 8 month old child. For a long time she has lived in a wooden house built on stilts, inhabited by 6 people. With the goal of replacing the wood of the house she is requesting her first loan to buy materials like wood, zinc laminate, nails and pay for labor costs. Her dream is to have a house made out of concrete.

loans.use: to replace the wood on her stilt house.

loans.name: Chuchie

texts.en:
Chuchie is 42 years old and a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients for her food business.

Chuchie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 26 years old and married with two children, both of them in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Liezl has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store  for four years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 40 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchen-wares and ingredients for her restaurant.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchen-wares and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie, 41 years old, is married and has seven children, three of them in school. Tessie works hard to provide for her family. For the past twenty years, she has run a general store  in the Philippines and she also earns an income from fish vending. Tessie has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. Tessie aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Moto

texts.en:
Moto is 27 years old and married with one child. 

She wants to start a small business selling vegetables in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a spade, a rake, gloves, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, and a weedsprayer. 

In the future, Moto hopes to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in June this year 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spade, a rake, gloves, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, and a weedsprayer

loans.name: Veronica Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia Veronica Cecilia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Veronica Cecilia works at her grocery store business. She sells basic food products like rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. She works from 8 am until 7 pm. She has been in this business for 5 years and things are going well for her. Her dream is to expand her store selling groceries. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. She is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Ruth  se dedica al negocio de venta de productos alimenticios, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 3 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos alimenticios. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos alimenticios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ruth works at her business selling food products from 8 am until 5pm. She has been running her business for 3 years and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her food selling business. Ruth is requesting the loan to buy food products. She is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the payment of the installments.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Munkhchimeg

texts.en:
Munkhchimeg, 39 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been selling clothes at an outdoor market since 2009. Her husband is a welder and works at a construction site. Their two children both go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as hardwood floors, wallpaper, and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place. 

Most importantly, her family will burn less coal for heating because of good renovation. Munkhchimeg is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Bayarbold

texts.en: Mr. Bayarbold, 28 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been driving a minivan for public transportation since 2012. His wife helps him by collecting fees. Due to their financial difficulties, they are working very hard, and once living standard improves, they plan on having a baby. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel compared to other engines. The electric car will be used by the borrower for transportation purposes. It will generate more income than the minivan does.

loans.use: to buy electric car

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a la ganaderia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo lo que producen sus ganados como leche, la socia años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos y para realizar algún arreglo de su retablo.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This credit group member continues devoting herself to raising livestock. She is a hardworking and responsible person. She continues to sell the dairy products, such as milk, that her cows produce. She has devoted herself to this business for years, which brings her both financial and personal satisfaction. 

The member wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of feed, and to repair her altar. She is happy to have the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase feed, and to repair her altar.

loans.name: Ma. Retchel

texts.en:
Ma. Retchel is 43 years old.  She is married and has four children. Three of her children are in school.  Ma. Retchel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Ma. Retchel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.  Ma. Retchel aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juana Alejandra

texts.es:
Hace cinco años, Juana tenía varios planes para sacar adelante a su familia, sin embargo, no tenía el dinero suficiente para poder cumplirlos. Ya era hora de pagar los gastos de la casa y el colegio o la universidad de sus 7 hijos de las edades entre 22 a 9 años, pero los ingresos de su esposo como albañil no eran suficientes. Fue entonces cuando decidió pedir un financiamiento a una institución y emprender su propio negocio. Ahora, esta comerciante de 55 años, que solo pudo estudiar su primer grado de primaria, debido a sus bajos recursos económicos, cumple 4 años con su pulpería, en la cual también vende comida rápida como tacos y enchiladas.
Juana tiene expectativas bastante altas para su negocio, pues no duda en invertir todo lo necesario para seguir creciendo también con el apoyo de dos de sus hijas. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para invertir en productos como maíz, frijoles y azúcar, los cuales actualmente no tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella sabe que diversificando los productos podrá crecer y poder darles a sus clientes una mejor atención. Juana sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad, por lo que sus planes serán seguir trabajando fuerte para ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Five years ago Juana had various plans to get ahead with her family. However she did not have the money to carry them out. It was the time to pay the household expenses and for school and university for her 7 children who are aged from 7 to 22 years old. But the income of her husband who works as a bricklayer was not sufficient. It was then that she decided to request a loan from an institution and start her own business.

Now she is a 55 year old business woman who only studied up to Grade 1 due to a lack of financial resources. She has run her small grocery store for four years where she also sells fast food like tacos and enchiladas.

Juana has high expectations for her business and without doubt she will invest anything necessary to continue to grow. She also can count on the help of two of her daughters. So she is requesting a loan to purchase products like corn, beans and sugar which she presently does not offer her customers. She knows that diversifying her stock can help her grow and provide better service to her customers. Juana dreams of seeing her children graduate from university so her plan is to continue working hard to expand her business and increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en:
Etevise is a 49-year-old married woman with 4 children.  For 3 years she has operated a small plantation, growing cabbage, cucumber, and beans to earn a living.  

Etevise has requested a loan to buy knives, a spade, wires, and seeds.  She has been a member of SBPD since 2012.  With her profit, Etevise hopes to improve her business and use the profit to expand.

loans.use: to buy a spade, knives, wires, and seeds (cabbages,cucumbers,beans).

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
In the year 2009, Merlyn learned about Paglaum MPC and immediately signed up for membership.  As a farmer in Blancia, Molave, Merlyn tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start a rice production operation.  After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital.  To this day, Merlyn feels she owes her good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, she obtained a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season.  Merlyn wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as organic fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Badegna I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA I est constitué de 9 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALABA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  2ème prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée de BIBA DRAMANE, la 2ème femme debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des semences,  payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 60 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The Badegna I group consists of nine married women who on average are 37 years old with five children, all living in polygamous families in Falaba, one of the villages of Bougouni in the third administrative region of Mali. 

They have been working with the  Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their winter farming activities. They are on their second loan with the institution, and the past loan was fully repaid. 

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Biba Dramane, the second woman standing from right to left in the photo. With her ​​loan, she will buy seeds, and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain two hectares (about 4.94 acres). 

After the harvest the production will be sold in the village market to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 60,000 CFA francs per crop season. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase seeds; pay for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Khongorzul

texts.en:
Khongorzul is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been selling mattresses at the bazaar since 2007. They take turns in selling the mattresses. Their daughters are under age and someone has to stay at home with them. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy mattresses in large quantities as a reserve for the coming holidays, so that she can continue to sell mattresses without worrying about an inventory shortage, as well as protecting her business from price increases. Over the next three months, demand for mattresses increases drastically due to the wedding season.

loans.use: to buy mattresses in large quantities to resell.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbaatar is 57 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He provides taxi services to local people and works part time at the high school as a sentry for additional income. 

He used his previous loan to renovate his elder daughter's house. This time, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials, such as fiberglass, foam and planks for house renovation. He hasn't renovated his own house for a long time. So it is time he renovated his house as winter is approaching. A renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and then release less pollutants into air.

In the profile picture, we can see the borrower together with his wife. They have lived together for 37 years.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Badegna Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA II est constitué de 10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALABA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  2ème prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée de MAYATOU, la  1ère femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des semences, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 30 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur menage.
texts.en:
The Badegna II group consists of ten married women who on average are 35 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Falaba, one of the villages of Bougouni in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their winter farming activities. They are on their second loan with the institution, and the past loan was fully repaid.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mayatou, the first woman standing from left to right in the photo. With her ​​loan, she will buy seeds, and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain two hectares (about 4.94 acres).

After the harvest the production will be sold in the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to make a profit of 30,000 CFA francs per crop season. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase seeds; pay for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is 30 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are in school. Rubelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rubelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rubelyn aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, vive en una casa familiar, a pesar de ser soltero tiene un hijo que está bajo su cuidado, su lucha constante es trabajar para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su hijo; Carlos tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos, trabaja de lunes a sábado en un horario de seis de la maña a seis de la tarde, su negocio está ubicado en una propiedad de un familiar por que no paga alquiler.
Invertirá en la compra de pinturas, masilla y otras herramientas que sean necesarias para realizar sus trabajos  y hacer que se negocio sea más popular, espera que sus ingresos sean mayores y no tener dificultades en el pago de su deuda.
Su sueño es tener un negocio mejor equipado para mantenerse trabajando y tener la posibilidad de cambiar su estilo de vida familiar, asegurándose que su hijo tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in his family's home. Although he is single, he has a son who is under his care.  He always struggles at work to cover his and his son's basic needs.  Carlos has a body and paint shop for vehicles.  He works from Monday through Saturday with a schedule from 6 AM to 6 PM.  His business is located on family property so that he doesn't pay rent.

Carlos will spend the money to bay paints, filler, and other tools needed to carry out his work and make his business more popular.  He hopes his income will be larger and he will not have trouble paying off the debt.  His dream is to have a well-equipped business in order to support himself working and be able to change his family life style.  This will make it sure that his son will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy paints, filler and tools

loans.name: Cesar Noel

texts.es:
El señor Cesar Noel de 44 años de  edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica desde hace 15 años al negocio de destazo de ganado, cerdos y venta de leche sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y demás personas de San Lorenzo y otros lugares de la zona.
Don Cesar Noel vive en el sur de Honduras, es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar 20 cerdos de 1,000.00 cada uno y luego dentro de tres meses los venderá a un mejor precio, espera que esta inversión le genere los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Uno de sus sueños es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -Julio de 2014
texts.en:
Cesar Noel, 44 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  For 15 years he has earned a living butchering cattle and pigs and selling milk.
His customers are his neighbors and others in San Lorenzo and nearby places.  Cesar Noel lives in southern Honduras.  He is an enterprising man who wants to get ahead in life and struggles day after day to improve his quality of life.  

Cesar Noel is asking for a loan to buy 20 pigs at 1000 HNL each.  Within three months, he will sell them at a better price.  Cesar Noel hopes that this investment will earn him the income needed to improve his standard of living.  One of his dreams is to grow with his business in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 38 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Rosalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending. Rosalia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rosalia aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling foot-wear in the Philippines. Marialyn has been in this business for five years, and earns more income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy stocks of foot-wear to sell to customers.

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of foot-wear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ma. Dila

texts.en:
Ma. Dila is 46 years old and is married with six children. Three of her children are attending school.

Ma. Dila earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from farming rice and a general store businesses. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 46 years old and is married with four children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ligaya has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ligaya is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Badegna Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA III est constitué de10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALABA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  2ème prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursés.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée de BINTOU YOUSSOU, la 2ème femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des semences, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 20 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The Badegna III group consists of ten married women who on average are 32 years old with five children, all living in polygamous families in Falaba, one of the villages of Bougouni in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their winter farming activities. They are on their second loan with the institution, and the past loan was fully repaid.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Bintou Youssou, the second woman sitting from right to left in the photo. With her ​​loan, she will buy seeds, and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain one hectare (about 2.47 acres).

After the harvest the production will be sold in the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to make a profit of 20,000 CFA francs per crop season. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, pay for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Badegna Iv Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA IV est constitué de 8 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALABA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali.

Elles sont à leur  2ème prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée de AWA DRAMANE, la femme1ère femme debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.

La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 30.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.

After the harvest the production will be sold in the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to make a profit of 30,000 CFA francs per crop season. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: Buy seeds; pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 56 years old and is married with three children. Two of her children are in school. 

Linda is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for twenty years. Linda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack food, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Linda would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack food, canned goods, etc..

loans.name: Joefel Joy

texts.en:
Joefel Joy works hard to support her family. She has a used clothing business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for five years. 

Joefel Joy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of used clothing to sell to customers. 

In the future, Joefel Joy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI I est constitué de10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SIRAKORO, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale.

After the harvest the production will be sold in the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to make a profit of 60,000 CFA francs per crop season. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.name: Gamma Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socios laboriosos, y coordinado por la señora Belki de 20 años de edad, acompañada y madre de un hijo de la edad de tres años, quien es su motivación para su superación, se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva en su comunidad desde hace tres años, este negocio lo impulso por medio de un ahorro que tenía con su esposo, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de mercadería de ropa como es camisetas, talladores, camisolas, brasier, licras, blúmer, bóxer, tobilleras, etc., con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y poder ofrecerle mejor condición de vida a su hijo. Otras de las socias es la señora Martha de 30 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta elaboración y venta de nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, hojas de chagüite, carne de cerdo, etc., la señora Fátima de 18 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de fritanga por las tardes y productos varios en su domicilio, la señora Rosa Lina de 42 años de edad quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cosa de horno, las comercializa en su comunidad y el crédito lo invertirá en quintal de maíz, azúcar, queso, etc. Las socias muestran diversas maneras de trabajar para obtener mejores ingresos y poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
This communal bank has four working members and is coordinated by Belki, who is 20 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3-year old son, who is her motivation for self-improvement, and has been selling new clothes in her community for 3 years. She started the business with the savings she had with her husband and now requests a loan to buy clothing items, such as t-shirts, shirts, bras, leggings, underwear, ankle support, etc. Her goal is to increase her income and provide her son with a better quality of life. 

Martha is another member of the group. She is 30 years old and works making and selling "nacatamales" (maize, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaf) in her house. She has been in the business for 4 years and will use the loan to buy corn, "chagüite" leaves (banana tree leaves), pork, etc. Fátima, who is 18 years old, sells fried food in the afternoons as well as other products in her house. Rosa Lina, who is 42 years old, makes and sells "cosa de horno" (a traditional Nicaraguan dessert) in her community. She will use the loan to buy corn, sugar, cheese, etc. All four members have different working styles to improve their income and provide their families with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Angelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 58 years old, married, and has five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josie is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josie has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is 24 years old from Paniqui, Tarlac. He has four siblings and their family’s source of income is farming. He is taking up Hotel and Restaurant Management. What his parents earn is not enough for them; thus he wants to avail himself of a PHP 10,000 loan from Kiva lenders thru ASKI. He will use the loan as payment for his tuition fee. Rolly believes that this loan will be very helpful not only to his parents but to himself as well for if this loan will be granted it will definitely open the door for him to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Antonia is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Antonia has a general store business in the Philippines. Antonia requested a 14,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries like coffee, canned goods, sugar, toothpaste, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Antonia has been in this business for 11 years. Antonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like coffee, canned goods, sugar, toothpaste, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Virgie has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Virgie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Neema Kimara Group

texts.en:
Rose, aged mid forties, is a widow taking care of her school age son. For three years now, she has been supporting her family by running a restaurant, a business she has been involved in after her husband died, when she was left with no source of income to manage her family. She serves breakfast (tea with bites) and lunch food such as rice, ugali (a hot, sticky dough made from rice flour) with beans, meat and vegetables. Working from 6 am to 6 pm daily she is able to make a small profit each month.

This is her twentieth loan via Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. She used the previous loans, since repaid, to buy stocks of rice, beans, sugar, maize and baking flour. She received an extra income which she used to buy a plot of land and cover school fees and household expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a house for her family. With her new request, Rose will use the loan money to buy food cooking ingredients for her new mama lishe (local restaurant or cafe).

She will share this loan with her loan group 'Neema Kimara' which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for her new mama lishe.

loans.name: Anamy

texts.en:
Anamy is 34 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

Anamy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Anamy has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Anamy aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Esther, a businesswoman and mother of three children, is in her thirties and not married. Esther's children are in school. She has been supporting her family by running three businesses; poultry, tailoring and chips with meat fried in pieces. She has been with these businesses for three years now, working from 9 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a fair profit each month.

This is her first loan request via Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Singida's, six group members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Esther will invest her portion to buy clothes making materials. In the coming years, she would like to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy clothes making materials.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 31 years old, married, and has three children.

Ginalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Ginalyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Ginalyn aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mzambarauni Group

texts.en:
Cesilia is in her thirties and has two children who are in school. She is single and for thirteen years she has been running a shop selling clothes. She works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a fair profit each month. 

This is her first loan request through Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to replenish her shop with new fashionable clothes. She dreams of becoming a successful mother with a nice family house.

Cesilia, together with other four members of MZAMBARAUNI group, will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her shop with new fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI II est constitué de 10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SIRAKORO, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale.

L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée de DJENEBOU, la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de droite vers la gauche.

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.

She expects to make a profit of 30,000 CFA francs per crop season. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband with daily household expenses.
